review_body: My wife & I stayed here between 26th February-01 March 2020.It was my first visit to Tokyo although a shock to the system ( Tokyo) we live in the country it’s very quiet.The Hotel was fantastic we had a corner king room a great location the staff were excellent helpful efficient and we plan to return.A special thank you to the girls at the Concierge desk ( Amy Lin & Miyuki Nishikawa for sorting out our return flights to London on Japan airlines who were also fantastic.Would recommend a trip to Japan especially this Hotel fantastic.Mark&Fiona Sullivan

One of the best parts of our stay were the staff, who were friendly and helpful at every turn! We stayed for 5 nights. The water pressure in the shower was AMAZING! The room was plenty big for three of us. Nice view of the Tokyo Tower from the balcony. Convenient to the Akabanebashi station which was great for getting around.The downside was how expensive everything was in terms of add-ons and restaurants. There was a charge to use the pool, breakfast was over 100 dollars one morning ( and one of us had toast and coffee only), and our first night dinner in the Chinese restaurant was nearly the same.I would recommend this hotel based on the quality of the staff. The only reason I may not stay there again is if we choose to stay in a different area of town.

Very nice place to stay, next to the park, close to all shops and restaurants. Staff very nice, bakery, SPA, shops and swimming pool really good. Great "no cleaning" deal, supporting the environment. Spacious room, with great view, Jacuzzi in the bath tub etc. Only prices and table charge for every drink in a sky bar were a disgrace.

Arrived at their amazing lobby reminded me of Harry Potter as we just came from osaka. It's not that easy to be lugging luggages to this hotel from metro as there's stairs so if you can taxi is preferred.Their room size is huge and bathroom too plenty of room to put many cosmetic bags and family towels. Good size for a family as not many hotels in Tokyo have big sized rooms unless you pay an arm and a leg. Lots of amenities downstairs with the mini art, restaurants with many different cuisines, bakery and cake shop. And is very near the tokyo tower, loved walking past the park. Plus its also quite near ginza by taxi. Very beautiful hotel with amazing and polite staff you can feel the hotels character and gracefulness the minute you walk in.

The room was spacious and clean. Service was good with staffs being able to provide accurate information. The staffs at reception and health club could communicate in English well. One needs to pay to use the indoor heated pool and onsen. The pool was meant for lap swim and there was lifeguard all the time. The train station was about 10 to 15 mins walk from the hotel. I used the free shuttle bus from hotel to the nearest station too. I might consider returning to the hotel if I am keen to swim and use onsen while in Tokyo.

I am in the lobby of the hotel waiting for the airport bus. My wife and I finished our holiday in Japan at the prince park tower. Mitsunobu Koizumi was very attentive to me when O checked in and ensured that we were looked after .Thank you Miyuki Nishikawa on concierge was very pleasant and patient listening to all my requests and made numerous restaurant reservations The top floor restaurants and the sky lounge offer excellent views for breakfast or evening drinks. The overall level of service and cleanliness was fantastic and I hope to experience the same should we return to Tokyo in the future

Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband as our Christmas gift to each other. It did not disappoint. Check in seamless and very helpful staff at the door. Large and well appointed room with a stunning view of the tower from our little balcony. Close location to 2 metro stops, great restaurants in the basement. We ate in the statehouse the first night, wonderful food and service for the set menu. This is great hotel which is super spacious and really caters for western and Asian tastes.

Exquisite experience from check-in to check-out. Clean, stylish, comfortable, spacious. Wonderful staff. Visit the Sky Lounge on the 33rd floor for breakfast for fantastic views of the Tokyo skyline. Memorable visit. Highly recommended.

The hotel itself is nice and seems to be an established location in Tokyo. My only issue is their lack of customer service. I ordered room service my last night in Tokyo, four hours after eating, a burger, I woke up with sharp pain in the stomach and was unable to sleep due to sickness. When I was checking out, I mentioned I had been sick all night. Their response was, they could not do anything unless I had a letter from a doctor! All I wanted was for them to apologize and investigate further.

Had a king size room with balcony on the 20th floor, with a lovely view of the Tokyo Tower and Shiba Park.Didn’t eat at the hotel as quite pricey. Plenty of places to eat locally. Easy access for the underground, approx 5 min walk away,

We stayed here for two nights as a place to get our one year old settled into Japan before we started our travels and it didn’t disappoint!Hotel entrance is impressive, the halls, shops and level 33 bistro are all classy and clean. Breakfast was impressive with a large selection. Room was very large, it fit the cot all our luggage and had enough room for baby to play. Bathroom was relaxing with great view from bath tub. Nearby was a little park, a dog park, a garden and temple for us to enjoy with baby having great fun running around (very clean locations). The hotel is central (very close to Tokyo station) and we caught the airport train to Shinagawa and jumped in a cab to the hotel arriving in no more than 20 minutes. Highly recommend to all forms of traveler!

Great hotel had a corner room, nice view very comfortable and clean. Staff very attentive and helpful has a pay to use gym, breakfast buffet is decent but pricey for what is served. Would definitely stay there again

Ten (5 couples) of us stayed here for a total of 9 nights over a 3 week period. We stayed for 3 night spells between trips to other parts of Japan and used this hotel as our base. We stayed in Club Rooms which were lovely. Good size, well appointed, all amenities were of excellent standard, beautifully comfortable bed and pillows all with excellent views. The Club Lounge was excellent with good breakfast, all day snacks, coffee, soft drinks and beer. The evening drinks were very good with lovely food. The Staff were very friendly and professional in the Club area. Couldn’t fault them. The only negative was the bar in the basement level. The service was terrible. Plenty of staff but just no coordination. Had a couple of later evenings there and it was the same on all occasions. The Sky Bar was excellent but very very expensive!!The location of this hotel is alright. Train station is close, lovely Park on the doorstep, restaurants a short walk away. The Hotel inside is far better than it looks from the outside. It was excellent.

I can recommend Prince Park Tower! Service and attentiveness unreal. Rooms spacious and comfortable. Views to die for! Did not experience any if the prior negative reviews. SkyBar is pricey currency depending might be only negative. LOVED our stay and wont think twice to come back.

We stayed in this hotel for just one night on our arrival into the country. We stayed in 724 which was a twin bedded room although we had asked for a double bed. The beds were very comfortable but the pillows were rock hard. The room also had a separate toilet which, when you open the door to the room, the light comes on, the lid pops up, and the seat is heated! We had a problem with the air conditioning in the room as we couldn't turn it down and it was stifling and an engineer was sent in minutes to sort it. He actually had to go into the ceiling space and we left him to it and went for a walk outside. When we returned the room was back to normal and the temperature was much cooler. As we were part of a group we were allocated a separate dining area for dinner. The food was quite nice but not really satisfying as you only got little tasters of everything although we spent about two hours trying the little meals. There was no meat at all, but fish and vegetables and a glass of wine. We went up to the Panorama Bar afterwards to take pictures of the fantastic night views over the city. Breakfast was buffet style with eggs cooked to order. Very attentive staff. Nothing available for westerners on TV.

Stayed in a lovely corner suite with beautiful views and comfortable bed. Concierge were pleasant and helpful.Went to the main bar for a casual bite as we were tired after a long journey. Unfriendly and unhelpful barman. Said no when I asked if could get a slice of cheese on the burger. After I said surely a chef can throw a slice of cheese on a burger he made a fuss over going to the kitchens to enquire like it was a huge deal. Food came - burger and club sandwich, delivered again by the unfriendly staff member. Both were awful. If we weren't so hungry after travel we wouldn't have eaten them. Burger was not fresh, was dry and tasteless. Club sandwich had such thick layers of mustard it was all that could be tasted. These 2 things along with a coke and one alcoholic beverage set us back near €100 when we finally managed to get the barman/waiters attention (we were the sole people in the bar, it was not busy). Worst food and worst service we jad in Japan. A shame as the rest of the hotel waa great, this experience really brought down our overall impression of the hotel.

The abiding memory of this hotel is dark brown and beige.The rooms are comfortable enough, convenient central location and lovely grounds/adjacent parks. However the reverence and courtesy shown by the concierge staff is strangely unsettling.There is a nice view of the Tokyo skyline from the 33rd Floor bar but you pay a heavy price for a casual drink even if you are a hotel guest.The use of the swimming pool in the basement is strictly regulated. You are bizarrely assigned when and in which section that you can swim. When deemed “full”, no one can enter until someone has got out. Raised eyebrows if you are perceived to be overrunning your “slot”. Woe betide anyone with a tattoo or a piercing as you wont be allowed in, which effectively rules out most of the UK population under 30.Also the management appears to be economising on the electricity bill as every other one of the downlight bulbs has been removed creating a twilight zone in the corridors and lift lobbies.

I love this hotel, the beds are like sleeping on a cloud! The views from my corner Room was amazing of the Tokyo skyline, it’s also looks over a Japanese style park where every morning I watch people walking their dogs.I must recommend the skyline bar which is on the 33rd floor again it has amazing views, and the bar staff are very professional in cocktail making.On my arrival I was greeted by H.Hayashi, she was very humble and sweet and greeted me with a big happy smile, well done to you for brilliant service.If you come to Tokyo you should stay here.

This is a very centrally located modern hotel. Close to major attractions and downtown. The amenities and guests services are top notch. Will highly recommend. I particularly enjoyed its food and bar outlets, especially it’s break offerings.

Excellent hotel, very large room for Tokyo, with very large western style bathroom with massive glass shower and pink granite bathtub. Modern hotel with excellent services and car or bus service to the airports. Recommended.

The Prince Park Tower is an upscale modern hotel. I enjoyed a pleasant stay of four nights on business.The hotel is moderate walking distance from Hamamatsucho station. It also has a shuttle bus half-hourly during the day; and other metro stations are closer if you want to navigate that system.English language issues are offen complex in Japan: no one at the front desk was fluent, but the staff were all very helpful. I arrived very early (8am) from an international flight - but they managed to get me checked into a room quite quickly. All the staff (and there are quite a few!) were excellent at all times through my stay.The room - mine was on the 30th floor - had excellent views, and was very well-appointed. An 'open plan' bathroom made for quite a feature: you could wash or shower whilst looking out of the balcony windows (or, close the screens for a private bathroom if you preferred). The shower and bath were combined in a spacious walk-in cubicle: but unfortunately, the shower head holder was broken, so it took some ingenuity to rig it up for a satisfactory shower.The room also featured complimentary Nespresso coffee, and high speed internet (both wired and wireless). Although I was on the 30th floor, I never seemed to have to wait too long for a lift/elevator.A downside is that although this is clearly an expensive hotel, they also charge a lot for extras. -- including breakfast, and seats in the 'sky bar' at the top floor! The gym/fitness center is also available at a considerable added charge. If like me you only need a minimal breakfast, I can recommend Starbucks, not too far away. It was a good stay, and I'd happily stay again - as long as someone else is paying.

We were excited for our stay at the Tokyo prince park tower but were disappointed. While the room was nicely appointed with nice views and bath products, the service was terrible. The concierge was disinterested and unhelpful while ordering a drink in the lobby bar could be an Olympic sport. If you order a glass of wine be prepared to wait as long as it takes to grow the grapes.

Stayed here for a three day layover in Tokyo on our way to the Philippines, and enjoyed everything about the hotel. Traveled as a family of four (teenage kids had a separate room), and the rooms were very nice, a good size, and well appointed, withe very nice updated bathrooms. Concierge service was very attentive, and everyone was always looking to be helpful. Absolutely nothing to complain about. Not sure about other reviews. Perhaps our rooms had been renovated, because they were nice and modern.The hotel is a five minute walk from the Shibakoen metro stop on the Chiba line, and just 10-15 minutes by subway to the Imperial Palace, Ginza and other spots. The hotel was perfect for our purposes, very nice, well priced and highly recommended.

I stayed for 3 night but had 2 reservations. Rather than poor me in 1 room they had me switch after 1 night.. but i got to see 2 rooms. The 2nd and 3rd night were on a higher floor, great and larger room that was 5 stars and made me realize how outdated the 1st room was. Turns out the pool is not included in the price. I asked if I could see it and surprisingly was told no. That i should look at the pictures. Strange. The buffet breakfast was very good with both Japanese and western options. The hotel is next to apark so is ready to go down and run in 2km circles. It's close to a few train stops including one that takes toy straight to Narita Airport. Walking to Ginza took 30 minutes.

They refuse to allow children under 20 in the gym and pool! Can you believe an 18 year old adult would not be allowed to swim???Not only that but they charge guests who pay $500-$1000 per night extra to use the gym and pool. How this can not be included in a 5 star hotel is baffling. One upside is that they do allow a family of 4 in a suite and provided 2 roll seats for the kids. Food is very expensive Location not suitable for western tourists, a long way from most sites. Shuttle to local railway station is a good service. Overall let down by dated facilities and ridiculous charges for facilities.
user_name:
MD_MD
From Australia to New York

review_body: Checked in to find pleasant, albeit old rooms. Planned to relax after a hectic few days travelling and was extremely disappointed to discover that the spa and pool are not included. The charge to use these both is ridiculous (and requires additional charges per facility). We booked this hotel primarily to use the pool and relax for a few days and paid above market rates for the booking.Terribly misleading system - would not recommend staying here. There are plenty other hotels in Tokyo which offer better services with newer decor and nicer rooms.

Visited the enclosed sky bar tonight at the hotel and was disgusted to find out that they still allow smoking throughout the bar area, even though it’s completely indoors. This hotel seriously needs to update it’s smoking policy before the Olympics hit town next year. Can’t be many people nowadays who would accept sitting next door to a smoker whilst having a drink. Totally ruined our night. Be aware of their smoking policy before booking at this hotel. Real shame, the hotel has been re-furnished to a high standard and the staff are really friendly, just let down by bad management and out-dated polices.

We arrived before check in time. The room wasn’t ready but check in staff happily changed it for one that was on a higher floor. The room was spacious and had everything you might need, except for coffee, tea only provided. The biggest negative was that the AC appeared not to function, could only get the room marginally cooler.Quite an uncomfortably hot night. Very nice meal in the Tempura restaurant in the evening, and a good breakfast next morning. Reasonable for one night, but wouldn’t have wanted to stay any longer with the AC problem, which didn’t seem to affect only our room, a number of people had the same experience.

The views from different areas were all wonderful especially level 33 where breakfast was served. Our room also had a lovely view of Tokyo Tower, Prince Park and the temple buildings. The view from the bar area at night also on level 33 was also fabulous (though it was unfortunate that smoking was allowed inside which spoilt the atmosphere). We intended walking to the Palace gardens and back but the weather wasn’t great so another time. Breakfast was great with excellent choices available. Staff were friendly and helpfully. The bed was comfortable and the room clean and roomy. Taxis were at the entrance and other transport options. We enjoyed our 2 night stay.

We really enjoyed our stay! Very friendly staff. Helpful concierge. Really appreciated the attention of all the different adaptors, Bose speakers...Ask for a room on a top floor, Great stay, Thank you for the great stay! Pascale

Phenomenal stay! This hotel is right next to Tokyo Tower, has some amazing restaurants (inside and within walking distance), close to the subway station; very walkable city.I had a gorgeous corner room that overlooked the Tokyo city scene, and the stunning view continued into the bathroom. The entire hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. There's a convenient hotel store that's open late hours, and when my coworkers and I were in a time crunch, it was easy to grab food at one of the hotel's restaurants. My colleague and I only ate at two of the restaurants in the hotel (there are over ten within the hotel), and all the food was delicious. I highly recommend the top floor restaurant, Sky Lounge "Stellar Garden," it has a gorgeous panoramic view of the city and the Tokyo Tower.As a bonus for business travelers, this hotel has amazing WiFi. When I just wanted to have some background noise on, I could easily stream HD video from the internet.

A bit of a blip when checking in, as we appeared to have booked a room type that didn't exist! Not the hotel's fault, more the booking agency, the reception dealt with the query efficiently and gracefully. The room was perfect, overlooking the park and with an amazing view of Tokyo Tower (which looked awesome at night). We stayed in a recently refurbished room, which was great with a bathroom to die for. The concierge was extremely helpful - finding us an excellent vegetarian restaurant. We had a lovely stay - thanks to all involved.

This hotel is a terrible. I am a frequent business traveler and here are the a few points that make this a must-avoid hotel:1. Gym not included. Super small and expensive gym/spa is in hotel, but not a good gym.2. Room temperature does not go below 75. Really? Yes, really.3. Breakfast buffet is sub par and costs 35US4. I had a beer at the hotel bar and was shocked when the bill came - $25 US for a draft Japanese beer. True story and a complete rip-off.5. No coffee in the rooms - another ploy to extract extra money from guests.Overall, the place just sucks. I had booked because Intercontinental had no room, but leaving after one night.

Was pleased with this nice, western-style hotel in Tokyo. Stopped over for just a night but loved walking the grounds, enjoyed the bathroom fixtures and the staff were incredibly hospitable and kind. The standard rooms could use some upgrading - they have a very different aesthetic than the sleek and modern lobby.

We stayed at the Prince Park Tower hotel for 2 nights prior to joining a cruise. We had one night provided as part of our cruise package and so the choice of accommodation was made for us.We were very happy with the accommodation that was provided. The room was of a very high standard and was spacious and clean. The two double beds were very comfortable. The bathroom had a very good vanity and a large walk in shower as well as a bath. A separate toilet introduced us to the joys of Japanese toiletting - self-raising seat, seat warmer and bidet facilities.The hotel was located very near to Tokyo Tower which was lit up when we arrived at night - this was quite spectacular.We had the choice of two restaurants at which to have breakfast. One was a silver service which was excellent. The impeccable service was really appreciated. They catered very well to our western tastes.The American style buffet was very good providing ample selection across the range of cereal, fruit, and cooked items.As we had dined in NaraMeguro for lunch we weren't overly hungry in the evening so didn't dine in the hotel at night. Rather we obtained food at a convenience store in the basement of the hotel - basement retail stores are a very common part of Tokyo hotelsReception and concierge staff were very helpful.We liked the fact there were two sets of lifts for the different levels of the hotel to take guests more quickly to their rooms. As there were a good number of lifts for each bank of lifts little time was spent waiting for a lift to arrive.As the hotel is set back from the road and has its own entrance it is able to accommodate a large number of taxis and tourist buses.It is located in the lovely Shiba Park. We were lucky enough to see cherry trees in blossom at the hotel although they were past their peak elsewhere in Tokyo.The cost of staying at the hotel is towards the upper end of the price scale but not untoward for Tokyo I believe. For the standard of the hotel and the facilities provided it was reasonable.

We did a one night pre stay here before a cruise. The hotel was very clean, and staff was very professional and helpful. The room was spacious, and had a french balcony that gave a very nice view over a park located on top of the hotel's parking garage, and of the Tokyo Tower. There are several restaurants on property, mostly on the high side price wise, but they were offering a special for hotel guests in the main bar for two drinks and one generous appetizer for the equivalent of $36, which in Tokyo is a pretty good deal. The bed was comfortable with high quality linens, and the bathroom was well appointed.

We only stayed one night. Our room was very quiet, spacious and well-equipped. The bed was so comfortable we didn't want to get out of it. There are three restaurants to pick from for breakfast. It is well positioned for touring and right next to Tokyo Tower.

We had a Premium King room (on the 31st floor) for our 8 night stay here so we had access to the premium club lounge on the 32nd floor, which totally made the stay (and price) well worthwhile. This club lounge access had many benefits including breakfast every day in any of the restaurants in the hotel (which we found to be comprehensive for all tastes); a driver to take you anywhere within a 10mile radius one way for free per day; a daily shoe shine; turn down service each evening; and so the list goes on. We found the room to be extremely comfortable - spacious; with a Nespresso machine included; free water each day; comfy bed and pillows. The rooms have been renovated in a nice modern style even though the outside of the hotel looks a little tired. The views were wonderful - our room and the club lounge overlooking Tokyo. All staff were extremely attentive. We would like to say thanks to Sakika (Club lounge) and Toshi (Driver), whom we had the most contact with. The location was great as well - close to subway transport, of which the hotel has a free bus service getting you to the stations. Having the hotel amongst the Shiba Park was lovely. Concierge staff were excellent and very helpful. We highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I travel to Tokyo for business every few months. The Prince Park Tower is the one place we will never return. They seemed overly concerned with whether or not we could pay for our room and were not afraid to let us know it. I don’t want to say it was because of how we looked but I have no other explanation for their behavior towards us. We would have spent far more time/money here (drinks at the bar, room service and spa) if they hadn't been so rude. We could not wait to leave. *Hotel management when you read this- please do not respond. This review is about your unnecessarily pretentious and inane business practices that you require employees to enforce. I have stayed in roadside motels and hostels that have more integrity than the Prince Park Tower.Do not stay here. Go to the Ritz or the Westin... just anywhere else.

The Prince Park Tower hotel is well located. The rooms are modern, spacious and clean. The staff are very attentive and responsive. There is a great bar on the 33rd floor, with terrific views of the Tokyo Tower. Even if you're not staying at the Prince it is worth heading to the bar for a drink in the early evening. I would stay here again.

We stayed in an updated room (and I think that is key) for 3 nights in April. The hotel looks dreary from the outside, but in the rooms they've renovated everything is nice and new. The room was quite spacious and we had a view of the tower. I could do without looking at the tower, frankly. It looks a bit like the love child of a transmission tower and a Berlin monument (one from the east side of town) but the view on that side did give us a good view of Tokyo itself. Staff was exceptional. Breakfast was so-so (after one time we skipped it; definitely had a hard time justifying the $30+ price tag).

The location of this hotel makes it special, it has the Shiba park as part of it.This is a huge hotel with 35 floors. The basement B2 hosts a large conference center. It also hosts 3 outstanding restaurants on the B1 floor.The lobby and level 1 accommodates shops and a cafe.The hotel has front and back entrances, the back one is accesses through the shiba park.Front desk staff are very helpful.The room itself is comfy, mattress and pillows are good.The bathroom is clean and modern.We had a premium corner room which has access to the lounge, yet the other junior suite we took for our family members and was more expensive, had no access to the lounge breakfast.To use the gym you have to pay 20 dollars extra per day, which is quite strange considering this is a five star hotel and also considering its high room rate.Breakfast food is not catered for all tastes, and the buffet is the same every single day of our stay.I hope the management considers the issue of gym fees, it is unheard of, otherwise the hotel is great.

I stayed 6 nights at the prince park tower hotel Tokyo.Pros:1. Very near to Aoyama, Roppongi, Ginza and accessible by public transport.2. Very Large rooms by Tokyo standards.3. Comfortable bedding, modern furnishings, toiletries and good showers.4. Lawson convenience store in basement.Cons:Check in experience is not 5*1. We arrived at 4:30 pm and were told our rooms were not available (check in was from 3pm). The receptionist told us that if we could wait for another 30 minutes she could give us a room with the Tokyo tower view instead. We said great, ok and she proceeded with some paperwork. Some minutes later she returned to say our original room was ready and we could check in immediately. We said we were happy to wait for the tokyo tower view room but she gave a half baked excuse and we just dropped the matter. Felt that was rather unprofessional and rude given that we had accepted an offer she presented but it was taken away without any proper explanation.2. There was no bell boy to help with the 4 suitcases we were lugging around and had to request help from the concierge staff to help to roll it to the lifts. Perhaps they are more frequented by business travellers with minimal luggage but still, for a 5* hotel.Nonetheless a comfortable stay.

Service was fine. Buy we had to wait on a line for 20 minutes to check in. It's a bit tired hotel. Lobby and hallways were dark. Room was nothing special but still nice. I wish that I could say more good things about the hotel. We did like the restaurant on the top floor but avoid the buffet.

Visited as a family of 3 - lovely spacious room, definitely better and cheaper room size wise than say the imperial. But we arrived before 8am. They offered to email if room becomes available before 3pm check in time. Unfortunately they didn’t do it. Not even to say that they can’t accomodate early checkin and didn’t offer shower facilities. Even during Sakura season when travelling w children high end hotels do accomodate and help w early check in. Dissapointing to see this was not the case at this hotel.

I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. I requested early check-in but the room was not ready; at first I was told until 3pm, then after asking again they managed to make it available by 1pm. Upon checking in I visited gym only to be charged $20 additional for entry, the gym was nothing special, in fact quite small with limited equipment, bearing in mind the room rate and rating of the hotel, I found this additional charge quite offensive. If you wanted to use the pool or sauna you’d be charged additional as well...(and if you have tattoos you won’t be able to enter).Later when returning to the room I noticed the shower was dirty - stains and marks all over the cabinet and the walls around the room were covered in dust.Furthermore no turn-down service in the evening, rubbish left in room on 2nd day and showers amenities not replenished.I raised these points at check out but no apology was offered, only a comment that the cleaning staff would receive a caution...Over priced hotel with poor cleanliness and limited amenities.
user_name:
Nicholas_cox1984
Jebel Ali, United Arab Emirates

review_body: The Prince Park Tower hotel lies in Minato area, with a beautiful view on the Tokyo Tower.The higher, the better - rooms from Floor 15 benefit from a splendid grand scenario, having the city skyline on the horizon and the Tokyo Tower just nearby.The hotel has a lot of facilities: restaurants, a bakery, spa, a natural hot spring onsen, hairdresser's, nail artist, conference rooms, fitness center. Please note that spa and fitness ask for an entrance fee, despite being a hotel guest.A special note to the Skylounge, located on 33rd Floor. At night the view on Tokyo is majestic and enchanting.Rooms are very big with all the necessary facilities. Shame the beds are not oriented facing the Tokyo Tower, thus doesn't allow a wake up with a beautiful scenario. Some rooms have been refitted but there is not a lot of coherence between the modern sofa and tapestry and the classic 90s wood furniture.A very good address to keep in mind.

One Star for the City Views. One Star for Kind Staff. This place is gross. It was a mistake booking it. My husband and I have been touring Japan. This is 1 of 3 hotels we’ve stayed in. It’s the worst by a long shot. While booking, it claimed to be a renovated room. We paid extra for this upgrade. Unfortunately it’s got the grime of a few decades. They would have had to reuse furnishings from the 1980s to make this place “renovated.” They clearly spent all the renovation money on the lobby. The cleaning staff is doing the best they can with what they’ve got. We chose the hotel based on the renovated room claim and city views. All three hotels we’ve stayed in had the same criteria and price point. The first two locations had exactly that. This place is so crusty and old I don’t feel comfortable laying in the bed. Or touching the floor. The bathroom is old and outdated. The toilet is at a tilt. It’s humid and hot. We had to keep the old fashioned blinds shut until the sun went down. The windows are so old they don’t have any real climate or UV control. The room was 77 degrees F for hours. The AC was set at 68 degrees F. It’s only 59 degrees F outside. I can’t imagine how miserable this room gets during the summer months. We can easily hear someone having sex on one side of the room. The splashing of tub water above us. It’s just such a disappointment to end our trip in this place. There are plenty of hotels in the area that face the tower. I’d suggest booking one of them. The closest JR line is at Tokyo station. If you’re planning on taking the JR train to and from the airport, you’ll have to walk 50 minutes or take a subway. The subways are not designed to take luggage up and down the stairs easily. There are plenty of hotels near the JR lines.

Very well kept modern hotel. Hotel is away from the busy streets of Tokyo as it’s a bit further to walk to shopping and restaurants.it does has a great view of the Tokyo Tower and lovely bar with the view. The staff are very helpful and there is a good Chinese Restaurant in the hotel. The concierge name Lin was very nice and helpful; ask for her.

The location is great . Booked the corner room . The view for Tokyo tower is one of the kind . Make sure you book early to get the best corner . My room was the second best corner . Highly recommend. 位置很棒。預訂角落房間。窗外東京鐵塔的景色很好。請務必提前預訂以獲得最佳角落。我的房間僅是第二個最好的角落。極力推薦。 附圖為當天拍攝

Stayed twice in this property within a month and experienced 2 types of room(can’t name them).On the first time I had a new spacious room, bathtub with view, Bose speakers, fine amenities. On the second time I got this dated room, separated bathroom and toilet, not so charming.Hotel staff could be any kinder.Property location is a down as no bus stops/subway stations right outside as many others hotels have.The building itself is an architecture gem. Beautiful inside and out, with plenty of restaurants, shops, convenience stores...

Flying in from London on a three-day business trip, I had requested early check in when booking as my flight would be landing in the morning at around 7:40am. The staff was totally inflexible and refused to accommodate my request (I wasn’t expecting immediate check in but some flexibility so I didn’t have to wait 6 hours in the rather inhospitable lobby (3 couches and a few chairs) and insisted they could only check me in at 3pm. My room was pre paid. Of course, they instead ‘offered’ (ironic!) to charge me more for a different room. Disgrace.

I stayed at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo during January 2019 for business travel.The check in team were great, even at quite a late hour.The room was absolutely huge, and spotless. The balcony is a lovely touch (although took a few tries to figure out how to unlatch the lock). The quilt was toasty warm, which is important during the colder months in Tokyo.The rooftop bar has a great view, and although I didn’t purchase anything from the bar, the hostess let me have a quick look.There is a convenience store under the hotel, accessible by the hotel elevator. I ate at a great little restaurant nearby called Komoro Soba, and I would highly recommend it, although assistance will be required from a friendly restaurant guest or waiter to use the ordering system.I had a pasmo card, and had no problems using the subway system, with a few moments of map assistance from station employees.For some travellers, this hotel may be a little inconvenient for getting to Shibuya and Shinjuku. I didn’t find it an issue though.I must make a special mention about Lin from the concierge team. I stopped by the concierge desk and explained that I wanted to purchase a ticket to the teamlab borderless gallery, but preferred not to use the online ticket purchasing system. Lin was amazing, advising that she could purchase a ticket on my behalf and leave it at the concierge desk. I simply left the money with her, and received a lovely email update advising that the ticket was waiting for me. I arrived at the concierge desk later in the evening to pick up the ticket, and noticed that Lin had written a beautiful card and included a personalised drawing. I have literally never received this level of service in any hotel, and it really was an unexpected, above and beyond moment. I really couldn’t fault my stay.

The Tokyo Tower view alone is something you won’t forget about this particular The Prince. It took my breath away every time I looked through the windows. The room was extremely clean and tidy and the bathroom was incredible. You won’t regret your stay and the hotel crew will make sure of it: they speak English really well and are really well trained and smile all the time. You’ll feel really welcome.

This is my fifth visit to this hotel and I love it. I came to see the january sumo basho and couldnt have done it without the help of the downstair concierge ladies lin tinghsiu and here superior. Tickets were almost impossible to get but they helped me get two tickets and arranged the hotel limousine to take my wife and i there. These ladies are so knowledgeable going as far as to show me a 3d image of the shopping mall i needed to go visit. The club level here is top notch. The food although repetitive is high quality. You can get scallops kobi beef prosciutto among other things and the quality of liquor is top notch. The breakfast on the top floor is also excellent. You can get both western and japanese food. As a club level member you also can get free room service off a basic menu. If you stay more than three days you can also make use of the hotel limousine . Lastly we went to myoko kogen and kusatsu for 4 days and they held on to some luggage and delivered it free of charge to the prince gallery hotel where we stayed when we returned.

Great business hotel, spacious room, got a good sized desk where you can work comfortably, loved that they have a balcony - so you can have some fresh air when you wanted to. Very clean. Also loved that the hotel promotes sustainability. You feel welcomed and comfortable staying there.Also worth to mention - the breakfast has clear food label written on each dish they are serving, so in case you have allergies, you know you won't have problems accidentally consuming the wrong ingredients.

I went here twice, the first time during May 2018 and the latest was in November 2018. Overall experience was outstanding. Location and room were excellent, and the services were exceptional. The hotel just steps away from Tokyo Tower and Shiba Park. Been planning for another visit to Japan, and this Hotel will be in my Itinerary for sure.

I stayed in this hotel for a week in January 2019. The rooms were large and very nice. I had 2 extra-large twin beds pushed together. There is a small (very, very small) mall beneath the hotel. The primary purpose of sharing this is to say there is a Lawson's, where you can buy convenient store items. There is also a handy machine that converts currency on the first floor of the hotel, outside the lobby. The hotel is located within walking distance of two separate subway line stations. I had breakfast every morning on the 33rd floor. It's a welcoming, sunny room that was delightful. (And there's a fresh-squeezed orange juice machine!) The service was excellent. On clear days, if you are on the correct side of the hotel, you can see Mt. Fuji in the distance. (I was in 2224, so that side of the hotel.)

First time in Tokyo and it was an amazing time. The room service was great, the food was great, the breakfast is a little limited but it was alright. The staff was very friendly and accommodating at all times. Great hotel, would stay here again!

The rooms are spacious, especially for Japan. We had a magnificent of the Tokyo Tower, and the temple grounds. It was a sight to behold, especially during springtime as the sakura trees are in full bloom. Service was professional, lobby beautiful. Breakfast was great, although, can be quite an ordeal as you have to wait in queue for a while. The capacity of the breakfast room should be increased.

The best stay I had in a while. Great lobby service and concierge was fantastic. We had forgot some flowers in oilur room after checkout and they had it when we asked to find it. The property exceeded our expectations. We are excited to visit there again.

We loved this hotel. We had a beautiful view of the tower and our room was spacious and comfortable. There was a whirlpool tub in the spacious bathroom and lovely amenities. There is a fine onsen on the lower floor where I spent a lovely couple of hours relaxing and meditating. The restaurants and bar are first rate and the staff is exemplary. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The prince park tower has a Japanese restaurant in its basement floor that has an excellent set menu! Food that is prepared exceptionally well fromIngredients and produce to skillful cooking, and though pricey is worth the money.

Great hotel, nicely renovated, staff are super keen and helpful. This is the kind of 5 star hotel that I experienced when I was a kid. Now a major draw back of the hotel is that it doesn’t have kids channel on TV, perhaps a Japanese kids channel but not an English one, this has made our day in room considerably harder than usual, I guess this draw only applies to family with kids

Large room with picture postcard view of Tokyo tower. Fresh, renovated and very comfortable. Reservations staff was very efficient in handling special request for birthday cake on arrival. Concierge Amy was very helpful and efficient in getting us tickets and other matters. Free Shuttle service to Hamamatsucho station was very convenient to airport connection and other destinations. Another subway station is five minutes by walk. Surrounding area is very quiet with no restaurants or shops. You need to get out of the area.

It is an amazing hotel! The staff are so nice and the location is great! We had a Tower view and it was awesome. The rooms are so nice and so clean. Would recommend staying here while you're in Tokyo.

This was the first place we stayed on our two-week trip. There are so many places to stay in Tokyo, so many different neighborhoods, it can be daunting to find the “right” place. I was very pleased with the Prince Park Tower. It is an elegant building that borders a park and is literally two to three blocks from the Tokyo Tower. In fact, we had a marvelous view of the Tower from our balconies. We were a party of three. We reserved one of the Garden Suites. It was lovely. The bedroom was huge and had a seating area which was great. The bathroom was also huge and well-appointed with amenities. (They provide pajamas, robes, slippers.) The second “bedroom” was a tatami-matted sitting room that they converted to our second bedroom by providing a futon on which to sleep. The added bonus was a second bathroom. (One note however – the second bathroom was only a toilet and a sink. No shower. No outlets. But nice to have.) There is a small entryway where you can leave your shoes. The entryway had a sink, fridge, Nespresso machine, mini-bar. Very nice.Because of the time we arrived (early evening), and because we were a bit dazed from our travels, we took an easy way out for dinner that night and went to the roof-top bar for a light bite. It is very expensive! Cocktails were $20-30 a drink. And we were assaulted with cigarette smoke (something we’re not used to in America). But the view was stunning – the Tokyo Tower is beautiful at night.We spent the next day walking around getting our bearings. The PPT is less a 10-minute walk to the Hamamatsucho Train Station where we were able to exchange our JR vouchers for passes. We spent several hours taking the loop train around Tokyo, hopping off and on to explore. As we headed back, we walked around the park that the PPT is situated on. It is chock-full of temples and sites and then walked to the Tokyo Tower. It was great. We dined out that night and left the next day to Nagoya for the F1 race.The staff at the Prince Park Tower are amazing. The check-in and check-out process was easy and didn’t take much time. They helped us forward our luggage to the next hotel. The women working there look so smart in their uniforms: very professional, very welcoming, very lovely. That they take pride in their work is obvious. I would highly recommend this place!

Stayed here due to its close proximity to the office. I had a great corner king room with a fantastic view of the tower.We arrived at the hotel about 10am, and was told our rooms were not ready yet and it should be ready by 3pm. We wandered off but was exhausted and went back to the hotel at 245pm hoping that the room would be ready. It wasn’t, so I asked if we could have a welcome drink - but there isn’t any. It would have been nice to welcome weary visitors who are waiting for rooms with a drink.The rooms also do not have body lotion, so pls bring some. Location is close to the train station but I’d personally prefer staying somewhere more central with shops all round.

Stayed here for a business trip and can say this was one of the best hotels in recent times. Location was great, close by to many places, the hotel itself had very good size rooms, great restaurants and overall fantastic service.

The location next to Tokyo Tower is great... I love this property because you do not have other big buildings right next to you. The property is spacious. The rooms very very comfortable, well appointed and excellent views. We were on 28 and welcomed Mt. Fuji on these days with clear weather. We could stay here for weeks , lol. The SKYBAR is not to be missed. Go early it, gets busy. We sat directly in from to Tokyo Tower... the drinks were fantastic. Smoking is permitted, which is why we didn't stay longer. But overall, its a great place to have a drink with a priceless view. The staff are very helpful and always with a smile. We will always come back here. Mahalo nui loa

This hotel offers nice and clean room, very service focuced staff and a great breakfast buffet from the 33rd floor with a lovely view. Comfortalbe bed and a nice bathroom all makes it easy to choose this hotel again.

Remarkable property, rooms with great views and staff that go out of their way to help and be courteous.We were upgraded to a 29th floor corner room that overlooked the Roppongi hills and the Tokyo Tower.The breakfast was exceptional with a choice of three restaurants.Very centrally located. The room and bathroom well extremely well furnished. We had the perfect stay.

Very Nice Hotel, loved it ! rooms are fantastic, quite pricy but hey...it's Tokyo man...!The staff at reception desk are not all fluent with english so it was sometimes a bit challenging, but Japanese are so helpfull it always work out...very close to metro station and local temple.I had a voucher for a free noodle soup delivery from room service..it was delicious!Will definitely be back in this hotel on my next trip to Japan.

It has one of the best views in Tokyo. Beautiful and comfortable beds, bathroom and amenities are really great, good location with easy access to train stations to explore Tokyo and a nice restaurant and bar area upstairs. Now for what I did not like about it especially for a 5* hotel... Being charged to use gym and it’s very expensive, customer service at the front desk was tough especially because they all don’t speak English and then when you go upstairs to have food...You cannot even sit down as the first thing they want is your room and also to pay your bill. Honestly, how can someone stay at the hotel that is pricey and not pay? Overall I loved the feel and rooms of the hotel.

Hotel is location is very convenient..near metro stations. Its right besides Tomyo Tower...infact the tokyo tower can be seen though the hotel rooms. Breakfast is good and they have options for continental and japanese. Hotel has many resturants and a nice coffee shop. Rooms are nicely done and comfortable. Bathroom are wel equipped and had a jacuzzi. Service and staff are exceptional.

We stayed at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo this past weekend (8/172018 to 8/21/2018). Simply the best stay we've had in Tokyo -- thanks to the hotel. The service, staff friendliness and hotel location were just perfect! We'd look forward to coming home to the hotel at the end of each day. We'll be booking here again for our next stay.

I stayed here just over a week ago, and after staying various other hotels across Japan this was a breath of fresh air. Very clean, comfy, and spacious. I highly recommend staying here for any type of trip.When visiting Tokyo again I will be staying here and nowhere else

Spent 3 nights at the hotel. The hotel is near several locations. It is only about a 10 minute walk to the Tokyo Tower. They have a few subway stations within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel has a lot of amenities. You have to pay for the amenities. For over $300, per night they should come included.

We are staying this hotel for 8 nights and we are very happy and satisfied with this room. It is big and very comfortable, view from the room is beautiful of Tokyo city. The location is excellent! And the staff is very good service, and especially to Mrs. Yuko Usami from Concierge. She always helped us with heartwarming hospitality, with great smile. She has good willing to help and make our stay much comfortable. She is knowledgeable and guide us where to go in Tokyo and Kyoto appropriately. Make our trip more easier and comfortable. Thousand thanks to Mrs. Usami! Daniel & Limor Srur / Israel

We stayed in total 4 nights are the Prince Park Tower hotel in July 2018. We travel as a family with two kids (6 and 4 years old) and stayed in a twin room with additional bed. The room was nice, beds comfortable, although with the additional bed a bit crowded but that was fine for us as we really only slept in the room. The hotel is in a great location, close to two different subways and in walking distance of Roppongi Hills, Tokyo tower etc. There are lots of restaurants in walking distance too. The staff are wonderful and so helpful, great with the kids too. The limousine bus from Narita airport is very convenient as it stops at this hotel. Breakfast was nice, although not cheap. There is also a small pastry shop next to the lounge on the ground floor which we used sometimes. Great hotel, clean and modern, great value for money - would definitely stay here again.

I was very impressed with the service we got in The Prince Park Tower Tokyo. The staff are very attentive, polite and professional. I have stayed in luxury hotels in Tokyo before, but the service we got in The Prince Park Tower Tokyo was definitely one of the best! From the executive lounge we saw the sunset and the Tokyo Tower at the same time. The executive lounge view was beautiful, food was excellent and the service fantastic. This hotel is clearly well managed and maintained. Congratulations to the management!

Centrally located, close to business and major tourist locations. Rooms with iron, multi-adaptors etc. but a bit lean on the mini-bar. Close to metro and easy availability of taxis. Good spread at breakfast and quiet rooms. Amazing views from Floor 10+. Efficient and friendly staff.

We stayed here for 3 nites after a cruise. Great location near the Sky Tower, underground rails (if you can figure them out!) and food. All of the concierge staff were fantastic in helping us Americans in suggesting places to go and how to get around. Fantastic view from bar up high. Rooms are very nice.

I stayed for business and have to say that this is the best Hotel experience I had in my life.The rooms, the facilities and service in incredible.I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Japan for an extended period.

The hotel is modern chic, rooms are spacious with amazing views of Tokyo tower and the imperial gardens. spacious bathroom with shower room and bath tub, high tech toilet.Staff are very friendly and helpful. the bar at the top floor has beautiful views of tokyo and excellent service.

We stayed at this hotel for four nights while touring Tokyo. The front desk and concierge staff is friendly, efficient, and very helpful. The room is spacious, clean, and quiet (special kudos to Lin at the conceirge!). The bedding is comfortable. The bathroom is relatively large - includes shower and wonderful bathtub. The hotel offers a range of dining possibilities. Breakfast buffet is wonderful though on the high side. Hotel is in easy walking distance to subway stops. Also offers a complementary bus transfer to a nearby bus/subway station and monorail to Haneda airport. Very good value for the cost.

Our stay at the Pince Park Tower Tokyo was fantastic. The rooms are spacious and clean and we had an incredible view of the Tokyo Tower from our balcony and from the club lounge. The staff was very attentive, professional and friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel.

It was a wonderfull place to make business meetings. I enjoyed my three weeks in this hotel ! I recommend this hotel for business travellers who wants to have classy rooms, a good service and impress their guests in the Club lounge.

My stay at the Prince Park Tower was amazing. The hotel is well located with a few train stations walking distance. The room are clean and spacious. The staff is attentive and dedicated from the lobby to the gym and every restaurants of the hotel. The business lounge offers an incredible view, quality food and drinks, special thanks to Kao and her smile! I would recommend anyone to stay at the Prince Park Tower to make their stay in Tokyo memorable.

My stay at The Prince Park Tower Tokyo was memorable. The rooms are spacious and very clean and what about the incredible view from the business lounge! Also, The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful. This hotel offers everything to make you feel as comfortable as home. I greatly recommend it.

The location is perfect and the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean. Restaurants, shops, convenience store, spa, you can find everything you need directly in the hotel. The lounge for the premium floors is incredible! I recommended this place for a stay in Tokyo!

What a nice stay we've had. The Prince Park Tower Hotel makes sure you enjoy your stay. Kind and polite staff, clean and nice-looking room with a breathtaking view of Tokyo. There is alsoo many accommodations in the Hotel (Laundry, Restaurants, Spa, Gym, etc.) Highly recommend.

Fantastic hotel ! Restaurants and other services directly offered in the hotel. Nice rooms & efficient room service. Qualified and very smiling staff. Thank you Prince Park Tower Tokyo for this unique experience !

This hotel is situated in one of the most interesting spots for business or travel in Tokyo. Metro stations are near, there is an amazing park next to the hotel, and there are wonderful restaurants near. I strongly recommend.

Love this hotel so once again, I came back for another few nights of wonderful stay. An upgrade to the panoramic floor is highly recommended, and the difference is really a lot as the other floors are rather old and beaten. The panaromic floor has been refurbished and has a lovely panoramic window with a proper balcony and electronic curtain. The staff at Prince Park Tower Tokyo are especially warm and friendly. I came back very sick to the hotel one day and they immediately noticed and came to my assistance and walked me to my room to rest. They even folded me an origami bird with a get well soon card. Such a lovely touching gesture. My favorite hotel in Tokyo for sure.

Been there for business purpose. Excellent Business Hotel with fantastic food options. Staff is nice and courteous. It is connected to Tokyo Airport by Shuttle Bus services, so connectivity is not the problem at all. Walk around to nearest train station.

Stayed in the Premium King room on the 31st floor which had an amazing view of the city and partial view of the Tokyo Tower. The room was spacious, clean, and had a nice layout with an open bathroom with sliding doors for privacy. Being on floors 29 and up gives you access to the lounge on the 32nd floor where you can get complimentary breakfast, tea time, and cocktails. We took advantage of the breakfast each morning before we explored the city and found it well stocked with basic breakfast items, eggs to order, and beverages.Location was quite convenient to train stations and we enjoyed the walks around the hotel in the nearby park. They also have a shuttle that heads to Hamamatsucho station, which is convenient when heading to HND.Overall great stay. Staff was helpful and always pleasant.

+ location: next to a nice little park, zojo-ji temple, metro stations + amazing staff+ modern rooms, spacious and view a nice balcony/view+ really good value+ airport express bus from hotel is quite convenient - : nothing to report

This was my second visit to the Prince Park Tower in Tokyo. It is a great hotel, refurbished since my last visit. Located close to the centre of Tokyo, it is an easy walk to the Imperial Palace or Ginza District. Tip for travelers is to use the Yamanote line from Tokyo Station to Hamamotscho, you can use your rail pass and the walk to the hotel. The breakfast was also excellent with amazing views of the Tower and city.

I had to stay at the hotel the last day I was in Tokio, at night I had some drinks in the skyline view the ambiance is great.Food is not well assorted but snacks and drinks are awesome, for those who are not quite familiar with the city they offer a bus service to the airport for a fee which is not expensive.One issue I had was some times my room smelled to cigarette.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo. We had adjoining rooms with twin beds in each room. The rooms were very comfortable and concierge staff helpful with restaurant booking and good English language. The breakfast had an amazing view. If you are happy to stay in a quieter location in Tokyo, this hotel is an excellent choice. Also the best toilet on our trip to Japan!

I booked a "Renovated King Corner Room" with a Tokyo Tower view, and before booking, I examined the photos carefully to ensure the room I would be getting was modern, clean and new. However, upon arriving, we were brought to a room that would've been a stretch to have been called "renovated". The only "new" components of the room was perhaps a new mattress, desk and one armchair. Everything else from the furniture including headboard, cabinets, drawers, bedside tables, the entire bathroom, and decor looked like it was stuck in the 90s. The sideboards were full of scratches and scuffs, and the wallpaper looked dingy and aged. It was a far cry from what I would ever call "renovated". Luckily, after some discussions with the staff, we were moved to an actually modern room - a similarly named "Renovated King Room", that carries the same room rate, and had a nice veranda, all new furnishings, etc. However, some parts were still left unrenovated. Particularly the tub (it was kind of stained, full of scratches and felt grimey from decades of use), the toilet with old controls (don't all Japanese hotels now have spiffy new toilets with multiple options?), a very old yellowing phone in the bathroom (they could've replaced this easily with a new one), and the room controls for temperature and curtains were also very old. Why only go halfway for a reno and not complete the rest? For the premium price you end up paying, you'd expect a premium room. It's like dressing up in a wonderfully fitted new luxury branded suit, but keeping on your raggedy old shoes you wore in high school. What kind of impression would this give someone? Probably wouldn't stay here again. You're essentially only paying for the view, nothing else. Location isn't really that convenient or close to anything but Tokyo Tower.

I was lucky to stay in a Japanese style suite. I thought it was cleaver that it was on a lower floor, as there was no view at all, but the room was massive and uniquely decorated. I would say that the room was due for an update as some aspects seems a bit dated, but it was very clean and tons of space. The service in the hotel is excellent and the location was fine for me as it was close to my office. Taxi's are also cheap in Tokyo so getting around was not a problem. The breakfast buffet was good, but I was surprised to not have any asian food there. it was totally western. There is a Japanese breakfast restaurant downstairs, but after looking at the menu we decided to just go to the buffet. There is a shuttle to the airport at the hotel, so if you don't take a taxi this will be handy, and I believe there is also one that will take you to the train. I had a very comfortable stay at the hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again, but next time I would ask for a more modern room.

I m in this hotel in first to 4 th april , i love the hotel view , the hotel is clean with good staff and very good resturant on 33th floor , i love this hotel , there is only one bad thing The internet connection is so poor

I stayed in the hotel for 2 weeks. General consensus, its a good 5 star hotel. The room is nice and spacious (stayed in the executive floors). The hotel has quite alot of stuff to do like bowling and a convenience store and quite a few shops and services in the basement. The location isnt bad too. One thing that they shoiuldnt do is call their massage place a spa. Even though they have sauna and steam, theyre massage is just a sports massage nothing more, but i have to admit it was good.Now on checkout after staying for 2 weeks, our flight was at 12 am the next morning, so we checked out at noon and requested to take a shower in the gym before going to the airport at 8 pm. And the made it a huge issue! After going back and forth they told us to pay 2000 yen to use the shower in the gym! After a bit more convincing a lady at the concierge was nice enough to let us shower for free. Its these small things that make the difference, ill be nice and give them a 4 instead of a 3 since they fixed it just in the end.

The Park Prince was a very nice hotel in Shibakoen, Tokyo. While it was a little distance (30 min walk) to any shopping area, it had a great view of the Tokyo Tower, and the park nearby. Our suite came with breakfast which was served buffet style on one the top floors. The restaurant had all the North American basics with traditional Japanese foods. Most definitely the perfect view of Tokyo from the restaurant. I recommend staying here if you want to stay away from the busy street of Tokyo. If you want to be in the action, I suggest staying in Ginza.

We have stayed over one month at Prince Park Tower hotel in Tokyo. Somehow the travel agent happen to book us on the 29th floor room which we then found out that it has many benefits especially if you stay long as we did.The service and the staff of the hotel is extremely helpful and kind , from concierge to the staff outside helping you to get the right address to the driver.The 32nd floor lounge was an excellent spot to have breakfast, and later as a quiet place to work and read not to mention great snacks and unlimited variety of drinks for free.We have enjoyed that a lot during our very long stay.My only comment would be that for long staying guests the in room free dining selection should either be changed every week or the number of selections should be increased so is the food served at 32nd floor.We probably would have not noticed if we were not to stay so long,highly recommended..

The Prince Park is a gorgeous hotel with excellent service and amenities. I booked a room with access to the club lounge that was wonderful. The lounge featured a full breakfast buffet with made-to-order omelettes, lots of fruit and pastries, Japanese specialties and even beef and pasta. There were drinks and snacks during the day and another buffet in the evening. The premium service also includes complimentary room service such as a hamburger or ice cream and a ride in the hotel car (up to 10 kilometers).The hotel is right next to the Tokyo Tower and a Park with shrine in a quiet neighborhood. The subway station is across a busy intersection but easy and convenient. Highly recommended!

We checked in later in the day, due to our flight getting in late.Check in was super easy, the hotel is easy to get to via taxi or subway. quick walk from the subway. Hotel lobby is BEAUTIFUL. Hotel is also large so our room was a bit of a walk from the elevator.we had a giant suite - unsure if it was an upgrade or just luck. Room was more than enough, we had a garden view, and the bathroom was clean and had amenities in case you forgot something at home. Lots of plugs for charging your devices, and essentially had everything we needed. bed was comfortable..just a question- we were woken up by a gong out in the garden at 6am... wondering if that's a daily thing or what. hahaha

The hotel has a great view, spacious room and friendly staff. There are also a few restaurants available at basement 1 of the hotel as well as at 33rd floor that offer Japanese, Chinese and Western food for selection. I specifically like a sushi restaurant at the basement floor.There are also retail space at basement 2 of this hotel where guest can have access to a convenient store, among others.In terms of connectivity, the hotel is within a walking distance to a train station, and a shrine. There is also free bus service that go to and from Tokyo Station. In addition, guests can also take a bus to Narita Airport from this hotel. Just make sure to purchase the ticket earlier to better plan your journey.

My family and I stayed at this hotel while on holiday in Tokyo. We were pleasantly surprised as we checked in, the hotel looked very elegant and modern with great ambiance . The hotel staff were very attentive and the best part was that they have a staff that speak and actually converse in English. Traveling throughout different cities in Japan, the language barrier was the greatest challenge . I stayed at other hotels and sometimes even the hotel front desk staff could hardly converse in English which was very frustrating! This hotel proved different in this one aspect alone. I had several issues while staying here and it was very easy for me to ask for help at the concierge desk because they spoke good English. All my concerns were taken care of efficiently . The rooms were very spacious, clean and boasted of a beautiful city view. The scenic elevator gives you a nice ride up and down to each floor with the view of the hotel atrium. On the 33rd floor was a nice dining restaurant where breakfast buffet was served with a fantastic view of the park next door and the Tokyo Tower. The breakfast buffet had a decent spread of both Asian and western fare. On the basement floor, there are a lot of restaurants to choose from, mostly Japanese but a bit pricey. There is also a hair salon, nail salon, Lawson convenience store , shops and a spa right down in the basement of the hotel as well. The service places get very busy so reservations need to be made ahead of time. There are also in room massages available ranging from 30 minute to 90 minute Japanese shiatsu massages. I tried it a few times and it was very relaxing and massage therapists were very good. They spoke a bit of English as well. Overall I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and would highly recommend it to travelers who visit Tokyo.

We had a wonderful time at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo! The hotel is pretty and our room was comfortable and very clean. The amenities in the bathroom were lovely. Also, there are terry robes, slippers, hairdryer, nice iron and ironing board, good reading lights and all the outlets take US appliances. You can see the Tokyo Tower from the hotel and you can walk to the Zojoji Temple ( which is well worth visiting!) The breakfast buffet has many many choices and is a good way to start your day. It can be crowded, I hear, but we were in Tokyo during the off season. The American breakfast restaurant is relaxing with good service and both are on the 33 Floor and have great views of the city. We found the evening restaurants to be very expensive in the hotel. The area doesn't have much else to do around it. Minato is not a happening place. However, the concierge services are outstanding. They were friendly and VERY caring. I found they will go out of their way to help you around town, book any reservations and always have recommendations. I do seriously recommend you book your sightseeing tours or guides ahead of time online however. The best ones fill up quickly especially depending on the season.

I stayed in a Junior Suite and the room was probably double that of any other normal hotel room in Australia. Panoramic views of the park with excellent staff and easy access to the subway/metro. I personally liked staying this part of town and then visiting Shinjuku or Harajuku for the day, rather than being in the thick of it. Highly recommend but could be on the pricey side, depending on time of visit etc.

Some of the rooms are still being renovated but the high floors (where you'll be staying) are completed. I was on the 23rd floor and did not hear any renovation sounds. Traffic sounds are quite obvious though, if you face the city with the expressways. If you face the park and have a view of Tokyo Tower, noise will not be an issue.Having said that, the hotel is located about 1km walk away from the nearest train station (Hamamatsucho - JR or Daimon - Tokyo Metro). You would not want to walk this distance during summer. The hotel has a bus that runs every half hour to Hamamatsucho station though but that stops at 9pm. If you take a taxi, expect to pay around US$5. This is the only reason why I'm not rating it Excellent.Service is attentive and much better than Shinagawa Prince. But the prices are higher too.I like the tiny balcony that you can step out from the room. It is about 30cm or so in depth so I don't think you can put a chair there though.

My wife and I stayed here as a Christmas treat in while in Japan. We arrived around 1pm and completed pre check in, went to the lounge for a delightful tea. However upon returning to the reception we were greeted by a LONG queue of guests wanting to check in. WHY OH WHY do Japanese hotels insist on 3pm check in?? surely rooms are available earlier, housekeeping don't just rush round all the rooms at 2:50pm? So why the regimented need to queue. I complained and managed through some amazing customer service (but it did feel like were breaking the rules) to get our room key quickly. The room was superb and of a very high spec. The Lawson in the basement was useful, if a long walk, and the bowling alley was convenient. I would suggest to the team there that snacks is a little more than a couple of sausage and poured out pack of chips!Staff in the hotel were fine. The only other downside was the skybar. I am sorry to say but westerners will not pay to sit in a smoke filled room with no view! Period! We went to the Peninsula restaurant and bar on Christmas eve and experienced something far different and more convivial to global expectations. It can be done.People say get into the skybar early to get a decent seat, honestly I would say go early or don't bother.We were disappointed not to have a view of the sky tower from the room, but the next morning we woke to a view of Mt Fuji. Could say I did not feel short changed on that trade.Central location and some great bits. Sort check in and the skybar and you surely have a winner on your hands.

My wife and I had a wonderful time staying at the prince park. The views from the hotel were amazing , the house restaurants were delicious, the rooms were very comfortable and the staff, especially the concierge, was first class all the way.The concierge did the near impossible and acquired a reservation to Jiro ( sushi ) on short notice ... but they did much more... they guided us to several amazing dining experiences as well as to fun touristy and non-touristy adventures. The location was very nice, not in the hustle and bustle, but still close to everything via taxi, train , and even walking. I’ve included a few pics of the views from our room.

The hotel is very comfortable, and serves a very good breakfast with Japanese as well as Western dishes. The dining room is on a high floor and guarantees a splendid viewThe service is typically Japanese, which means very friendly and helpful and good. Room service is fast, punctual and tasty.

This this first time I've had o leave a review... Let me start by saying; I travel a lot for business and pleasure, and I'm also half Japanese so have a decent level of understanding of Japanese language, culture and service.After a 12 hour flight from London I arrive at the hotel at 7am and they cannot find my booking - I have confirmation of it on email. After 30 minutes of messing around they give a smoking room but promise they will sort it out and that the manager will call me.I hear nothing, and no apology at all throughout the stay, offers of compensation or any other signal that you'd expect from a top hotel. I order breakfast at 7am the following day and after 50 minutes have to cancel as they couldn't manage scrambled eggs on toast with an orange juice (30 minute maximum wait was advised).I then have to wonder the streets for breakfast (nothing is open in the surrounding area until 9am) and get back to catch a shuttle to the airport. Prior to boarding there is a state of panic as I haven't checked out, even though they have all my details and registered my cards.I expect to stay in over 40 hotels this year and would be surprised if I have a worse experience by the end of 2018.

This was my second stay in a one year period. The first time I didnt have club access but this time I had it and it is well worth it. You are able to eat breakfast in any of the restaurants. You can use the gym and limited use of a driver and car to drive you around. You can also order free room service off a menu once a day per person. You also have access to the lounge where you can find sushi and other appetizers and hard liquor and beer. Theoretically you wouldnt have to spend another dime on food or drink in tokyo.

Found this place to be very warm, dark and inviting. Awesome views of Tokyo and of Tokyo Tower. I love gin and tonics so place was great as there is a Tanqueray lounge area in the bar. Can be a little much as everything is lit up the Tanqueray green. Long whiskey menu and great seating.

Just moved in and loving every bit of it! Great room service , excellent food. Will highly recommend the Panoramic view floors for a splendid view of the city . The sky lounge is brilliant - food is good! Highly recommended !

Other reviewers have noted the views, with which I certainly agree, over Tokyo Tower and Zojoji Buddhist temple, both of which are easy walking distance for tourists. The room itself was very clean and well-equipped, but not luxurious. Service was prompt, courteous and helpful. Common parts are smart and spacious. Perhaps the best feature is its location: it is in the park at Shibakoen and just off Hibiya-dori, which road runs parallel to the main railway line. This gives easy access to Hamamatsucho, Shinbashi and Yurakucho and little further to Ginza, Marunouchi, Tokyo station and the business district of Otemachi, whilst Azabu-Juban with its village atmosphere and numerous restaurants is just 10-15 minutes walk away.

We booked a corner room, high floor with incredible views of Tokyo Tower. Lovely hotel with large clean rooms, comfortable beds and pillows and short walking distance to public transport. Bathroom was beautiful, large and full of natural light. Night traffic was quite loud and was disturbing to sleep. Expect long queues at check-in. Also, if you plan to eat breakfast in the hotel, it would be a good idea to go up and get a number and put your name down, as the waiting list can be up to one hour. Good selection at breakfast though. We only ate there once, and chose to explore the area and found some good places within 15-20 minute walk of the hotel. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, but instead walked 10-20 minutes and found some lovey local choices with amazing food. We enjoyed our overall stay, but would probably explore somewhere else next time.

The hotel is located adjacent to a very nice park and temple area. The corner rooms are great and have incredible showers and tubs. The restaurants in the hotel are nice but expensive. There are not a lot of other places to eat or drink immediately close by, but can be found after a 10 or 15 minute walk. This place even has a bowling alley that is not very well advertised but looked like it could be fun. 10 minute walk to train stations. There is also a very nice bar and upper floor restaurants on the 33rd floor. price and a bit slow service but great views.

Initially wrote 3 pages worth of criticism, but decided a shorter brief version is the way to go. Good:- Nice rooms, nice views Bad:- English proficiency low across most staff- Staff don't seem to be on the same page in terms of what services their hotel offers- Service is terrible when considering the money you pay. Small example - Celebrated New Years in hotels Chinese restaurant. Most of the evening were pouring drinks by ourselves. Empty bottles not collected. I can go on for ages.- Queues everywhere. From check-in to breakfast. Just to give an idea - we were waiting for a table at breakfast for an hour. Only on the 3rd day (out of 4) of our stay a waiter informs us there is an option to "book a spot" in the queue and hotel will inform us by phone when it's our turn. Helpful information that would have been great to know at arrival.Let me just say that these types of queues I met only once in the Disney Resort hotels and back in 1980's USSR. Stayed in 3 other hotels in Japan and have not come across such waiting times.Having left the hotel I called up a few Japanese friends and got unanimously told that the Prince hotel chain is well know for the "great" service and they barely pass for 4 stars at best. Should have called them before booking.... In conclusion, we felt scammed out of our money, but more importantly I'm spending my first week of the new year complaining.P.S. - I'm sure a staff member from Prince Park Tower will reply to this review with an apology, their perspective on the situation and statement about how my feedback is very valued and they are constantly trying to improve. Shame that staff training comes at the cost of guest experience.
