I read lots of reviews before booking so I am thrilled to write my own. My booking was a basic room only and I did try to upgrade beforehand as it was Christmas week. I need not have worried !! Our 'basic' room was huge and far from basic. 14th floor with breathtaking views day and night. The bathroom was fabulous and full of free products and we loved the jet bath. The separate toilet was all automated and wonderful. The quality of the linens, towels and robes was heavenly. The hotel lobby is extra ordinary and gorgeous. Lots of lovely people on hand to help with everything including delivering luggage to your room. We had breakfast vouchers for a reduced price on different breakfast options. We opted for 33rd floor panorama buffet. It was an incredible buffet of high quality fresh foods of every kind. The service was delightful and friendly. In the evening there is a cocktail bar on floor 33 which has to be experienced !! Not overcrowded and carefully managed to make it feel private. It looks directly towards the impressive tokyo tower and is quite an unreal and beautiful experience. I wish we could have stayed longer ! Other things :Easy airport limousine bus directly to the hotel from Natural airport. No need to book and costs 3000 yen which is around £20 each. On return just book and pay at the hotel.Hotel Wi-Fi is fast free and uninterrupted. Subway stations are very close by and it takes around 20 mins to Rappongi or Shibuya. We didn't use the pool or bowling due to lack of time or the other 6 restaurants ! We aim to go again asap !!

It was my family's first time to travel to Japan. We had done it during the long Christmas and New Year break. I had booked at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo. While it is a bit off-center of the city, it is surrounded by several subway stations all within a 5 to 10-minute walking distance. To get around the city, specifically Shibuya, we had to take the Akanebanebashi station. Tokyo Shinkansen station is a 5-minute taxi ride (so very affordable). Restaurants are about 5 to 10 minutes walk away as well. But in the biting cold of Tokyo evenings, we found comfort that the hotel has a Lawson's convenience store at the basement level. And it has everything. If you want to be a bit more indulgent, the hotel has a Steak restaurant and a Chinese restaurant as well. But do try the 33rd flr Italian Restaurant Brise Verte. My family and I had our breakfasts there and on a clear winter's day, it offers a stunning view of Mount Fuji. How awesome is that?!!! Also, the restaurant staff are very kind that they let my family sneak into the Sky View lounge to get a closer view of the Tokyo Tower. If you wish to have a relaxing evening over drinks, you can do so at the Sky View lounge. The Tokyo Tower is beautifully lighted in the evenings and will certainly amaze you as well.

This rating and the comments are for the lounge rather than for the entire hotel. I used to stay in this hotel almost 50 years ago and was yearning to return to see what had become of it. We had drinks in their lounge on the main floor and were very pleased with the setting: there is an exquisite small pebble garden outside of the large glass windows, gently lit as dusk settled in. We had a nice if a bit pricey glass of Sauvignon Blanc and a Cappuccino, the service was very discrete and polite and the ambience perfect, certainly justifying the price level (Y900 for the wine and for the cappuccino). A nice place to come for a drink and rest your weary bones if you are in the vicinity of the Tokyo Tower.

Fairly quiet by Sydney standards but we had fun! Hotel has western style 5star qualities with Japanese hospitality - checking in was a bit of a drag - needs streamlining but this may have been an aberration as it was NYE. Breakfast on the 33rd floor is worth the $40, great views!

This is a very smart refined dignified hotel next to Tokyo Tower. I stayed for 5 nights on a friend’s strong recommendation. There are things I thought very good and things not quite so good. However the not quite so good things were more based on me personally. It is a good hotel Good- It’s nice being next to the tower, temple and Shiba Park. This makes it peaceful- our room was great with an excellent view: at night we saw fireworks from the Rainbow Bridge- we had a delicious breakfast on the top floor with a wonderful view of Fuji San. The waiter in the restaurant was perfect.- I really enjoyed the relaxed lobby lounge. I could have spent a long time there. I saw people having afternoon tea, which looked wonderful and amazingly civilized.- The hotel has a “classy” atmosphereNot quite so good (for me personally)- the lobby seemed “stressed”. For example, my husband’s bags were temporarily misplaced. They were immediately found again when we showed a photo but after a long journey it’s nice for things to be “automatic”. There were a couple of other small communication issues too. Nothing major and of course it sounds like a “typical American” as I certainly don’t speak much Japanese!- Prices were high in restaurants, the gym etc.... but I suppose this is Tokyo- the downside of being in a peaceful area is that you are not close to “mall type” easy eating places (compared to other areas I have stayed in such as Shiodome). There are plenty of places to eat, but just not quite as convenient. Of course this is just a matter of taste.- subway is close, but the Yamanote isn’t and we couldn’t be bothered to wait for the shuttle bus so we did a lot of walking to stations and changing trains. However those more patient than me would find the shuttle fine.Overall a good hotel with lots of history and atmosphere, just not quite one that fitted my needs perfectly this time.

Our stay at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo is one to be remembered. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. It sits in a quiet section of Tokyo where the subway is within walking distance. There are two hotel shuttles and taxis available. Within the hotel there are a variety of restaurants, a massage and manicure parlor, a bowling alley, and a Lawson’s Station convenience store. This was an amazing experience! We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Tokyo.

Stayed here for three nights on business... friendly reception, good concierge service, good bed and view...and you can walk to some of the key sights/areas like Roppongi. Only downside was a misunderstanding about my bill, but that got sorted out soon and I even received a phone call afterwards. Will certainly come back again.

We stayed in The Prince Park tower for 7 nights and then returned to it for another 3 nights after touring the rest of Japan. Our stay was delightful. We stayed in the newly renovated rooms and they were very clean with a beautiful view of the Tokyo tower. The hotel is also situated in a good location, whereas you are surrounded by many stations and cafes.A special thanks to the best concierge, Yuko, for making our stay all the more memorable! She was literally the best part of our stay being ever so helpful with our planning and reservations. Would definitely come back to this hotel!-Farah

Was in Tokyo for a business conference and stayed three nights at this hotel. Excellent bed being a huge king sized one which afforded me a beautiful sleep each night. The room was well appointed with a desk to sit at looking out over the city skyline. There was also a small table and couch so you could watch TV or read the newspaper in comfort. The bar on level 33 is spectacular and we went there each night for drinks after dinner. Highly recommended for the business traveller or a romantic getaway.

Great team, great service. Rooms are of very good size. The neighborhood is quite central, not exactly near to most touristic places but close to 2 metro stations.Breakfast is very good with plenty of choices and a fantastic view you don't want to miss.Great business experience overall.

I arrived at 5.30pm on Monday this week and was told my room was not ready. I spent two night there and return Thursday at 2pm and had the same problem. They informed me that check in time was 3pm which was surprising. The overall experience was not good and I will not be returning.

What an impressionable hotel. Simply loved our stay here. We were upgraded to a higher floor, being an Expedia VIP member. The bed was HUGE and superbly comfortable with soft comforters. The bathroom amenities was complete and very nice, equipped with clean white towels. There was a Nespresso coffee machine for our coffee fix. The balcony could also be opened for a great view. The convenient location is near to some train stations within walking distance. Absolutely my favorite hotel in Tokyo.

The hotel is located centrally. It adjacent to Tokyo tower. It’s 33 floor building with fantastic city view or tower view rooms. The hotel lobby is very big and busy however it’s organised so well for ease of guests checking in or out. It has good Japanese restaurant and a bar... it also houses a store in basement ... the gymnasium is good and spa is well spread... the staff is very humble and courteous... looks like a great team work...overall a very good hotel to stay when in Tokyo

The hotel is well located in Tokyo with great views of the city. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The hotel amenities were excellent with a choice of restaurants and lounges, each with outstanding food choices. The best aspect of the hotel, however, was the exceptionally good service. Personnel were multi-lingual, helpful, and willing to go beyond the ordinary to solve problems and to assure your comfort.

The Prince Park Tower is a great hotel, centrally located, large and well-appointed rooms recently renovated so the room felt brand new. Nice finishes, very comfortable bed, everything you need including shampoo etc. and iron. Has small balcony to enjoy fresh air and views. Highly recommend rooms with view of Tokyo Tower. Included breakfast buffet in upstairs restaurant with panoramic views was very good.

Very central hotel. Has great views from our room. Rooms were dated, but the hotel looks like it is about to upgrade. Rooms very clean. The staff were very helpful, breakfast was buffet style with fantastic views of the city.

The hotel charges separately forThe gym and this probably not reimbursable by most corporates. Every transaction is like a JC Penney in the 80s. Carbon copy receipts and print ups for every purchase. Nothing is automated. In fact whole place is a 1980s time warp: decor, rooms etc. The whole place is in need of a massive facelift. Inconveniently located for most business travellers relative to central business districts. Outdated and unfriendly policies. There is a rule book for everything. The employees are empowered to make no independent decisions. I have found the entire Prince franchise to be terrible on customer service from a foreigner perspective and this hotel is not the exception. Most staff including the concierge and check in employees have a very low level of English proficiency.

The exterior of this hotel is architecturally unfortunate but everything else about it is exceptional. We love the location - very subway friendly. The staff - as is typical in Japan - are unfailingly kind and helpful and cheery. The rooms are lovely and luxurious and the views of Tokyo Tower - particularly at night - are breathtaking. As part of our trip to Japan we flew into Tokyo and stayed at a high end international name brand hotel for a few days until we headed to Kyoto, Hiroshima, etc. At the end of our trip we stayed here - thank heaven!!! Would now never stay anywhere else in Tokyo.We have learned that it is worth the extra money to stay on the premium floors with club access, not only because it is elegant but because you make up the extra cost by way of the free breakfast and what amounts to free dinner at the cocktail hour. There are too many amenitIes (fitness club, convenience store, etc.) to list in their entirety.We love this hotel!

The hotel room is very nice and very clean with all the amenities. The staff are amazing! Room service was fast and very courteous. Al other staff were very helpful. The location is very central and some subway lines are walking distance from the hotel. There is a very shuttle bus tha runs every half hour to and fro the hotel to Hamamatsucho Bus Terminal and the subways are there for easy access around the city. I only wish the hotel had more options for vegetarians on their menu.

Stayed for one night on 28 March 2017. Great Hotel. Got a great deal on Indian website. Got a complimentary upgrade due to my Preferred Hotel card. Very big size room in comparison to Japanese hotels. Tokyo tower bang opposite room and its view was amazing. Very nice pool area.Only one disappointment was that Hotel does not give even one bottle of complimentary water and same has to be purchased. This was not expected. Or atleast being a foreign guest, expected to be given. Overall (except water issue), a great stay.

I booked a standard room at this property online late night, 30min before check-in. Upgraded to a stunning suite. The hotel is a little out but close enough to the hustle & bustle. Smooth check-in, very modern and well maintained building. A 10min pleasant walk to the subway. I very liked the on-site shop with a wide selection of useful items.

Stayed for 7 nights and had a pleasant stay. Nice rooms that are spacious and welcoming. When I checked in they told me I needed to cceot a non-smoking room, to which I said NO, after a while at the check-in counter I eventually received my non smoking room, for which I was very happy. Restaurants in the hotel are very good, but probably high price, even for Tokyo. The hotel's location was convenient for the meetings I was in town for.

Highrise hotel, surrounded by small park (with temple/shrine) makes for a room with a view and easy place to stretch your legs. Large rooms (especially for Japan), speedy telecom, and access - via underground passage - to a number of convenience shops and facilities. Helpful concierge. Staff seem to have good conversational English, at times, even a sense of humor. There's a similarly named hotel (same chain) near by, be sure your taxi understands "Price Park TOWER"Only the dining facilities seemed a bit short of convenience: the breakfast are has a strict cut off time - perhaps not the best thing given number of jet-lagged visitors from outside. Price was well within reason vs more standard Western hotels in Tokyo (Hyatt/Hilton, I am talking about you!)Only caveat: Lightly attended Gym/Health club is reached by mall, carries an extra 2200Y daily charge. However, it is clean, offers additional spa service, and is better equipped than most hotel gyms.Lower level of hotel ongoing maintenance (October 2017), but in typically Japanese way, with minimal noise, dust or general inconvenience to customers.
user_name:
Blue_No2
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Last night of a 15 day Japan tour. Just what I needed to unwind before returning to real life. Hotel provides a shuttle bus from and to the subway which was very convenient. For a solo traveler I was very pleased with the security measures to access room elevators. Some of the elevators are glass enclosed and the interior views of tower were great. The views of the park, temple and tower from the room were superb and the lit up tower at night was a bonus. The attention to detail is remarkable right down to electrical outlets in the safe. Robe, pajamas, high quality beauty supplies, newspaper, etc. provided Downside was that you have to pay extra for the hotel spa facilities but with the bathroom being at a spa level it was not a big loss. Jacuzzi with a view! Breakfast was excellent. Depending on the purpose of your visit, the traffic in the hotel may be disconcerting to some. Being from a big city it didn't bother me. Service is good but not as personal as in some of the other hotels I stayed in during my Japan stay. Again, matter of choice. With those caveats in mind, I recommend the hotel.

Let's put it this way, my bathroom seemed larger and more luxurious than some apartments I've been in... just a slight overstatement. My bathroom and bedroom also had a view of Japan's Tokyo tower (Eiffel knock off), but still spectacular at night from both the bathroom and the bedroom windows. Indulged in a sushi dinner at The Prince's sushi HAMASHIBA restaurant. The tender tuna morsels were exquisite - the best sushi I've ever had and I've eaten a lot of sushi. For travel and foodie adventures near and far, visit onthelooselive.com.

We got a spacious three bed-room room. All three beds were single. Tea making facilities were good. Concierge services were excellent- taxi stand was within the hotel premises. The hotel had been recently renovated and the bathroom and toilet were separate. The toilet was fitted with the latest Toto automatic neo toilet.!

Service and hotel absolutely impeccable.Check-in is done seated at a desk, unless you are on a Premium Club floor (29-31) in which case you are escorted to the lounge on the 32nd floor (the premium room elevators can only be accessed by key) where you are greeted by staff and escorted to a seat in the lounge that has breathtaking views of Tokyo Tower, a park and the city. You are given a drink and offered food while your check-in is handled. A staff member returns with your keys and a list of all the Premium floor benefits which include: breakfast (cooked to order eggs as well as buffet) /light lunch/ evening heavy appetizers.an awesome array of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks that are available when the lounge is open. The food was the same every single day so it got a bit old after four days but it was all consistently good.You can choose to have breakfast in any of the hotel restaurants. There are dedicated elevator entrances so the folks in the restaurants know you are a Premium guest.One room service meal each day off a set menu, free use of conference room, members only spa/fitness access, discount on laundry, free shoe shine, hotel car (BMW) to take you anywhere up to 10 km from hotel. We used this service twice and it was a nice benefit.Our room itself was on the 29th floor with a King bed. An unbelievable view of Tokyo Tower and surrounding area. The bathroom area can be closed off via sliding doors as the sinks and dressing area, toilet and tub//shower are all in separate rooms. Note-the shower is next to the tub in an enclosed room so as you shower you stand on the floor next to the tub with a floor that has a drain in it. A few small annoyances: There was no where to hang towels so you need to drape them over the tub-seems odd at a hotel of this caliber as does the severe lack of drawer space. There were only two very, very small drawers. One of which had pajamas in them so that seems odd. Daily turn down service and ice delivered to the room, standard amenities (slippers, razors, brushes, etc...) Location is not prime bit it is close to a subway stop. Absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend without hesitation.

I can't fault this hotel but for one issue, which given its quality and price is ridiculous and that is having to pay additional fees to use an average gym. Seriously a property of this quality should have this facility included as standard. It's the first time I've encountered this issue when traveling the world.

The room was very nicely furnished - I think I got the renovated rooms. Location was good - within walking distance to a train station and convenient stores 10 mins away. The bar on the top floor allowed a beautiful view of the city but was often full so best to book in advance. The breakfast was decent and had an option of Japanese or Western cuisines. Only downside - they do not allow early checkin and will want to charge you for it, so make sure you come in after 3pm. Overall - would recommend this hotel!

Despite being under renovation, the Prince Park Tower remains a very good hotel. Well located and appointed, it made from r a good trip. Service was of a high standard, particularly the room staff, who responded rapidly and accurately to several requests.

We were in Tokyo to spend our 20th anniversary. When we checked in to the hotel, the manager and staff welcomed us and showed us to our room. They were kind enough to upgrade us to a room with a balcony overlooking the Tokyo Tower. The manager left us a nice note along with some sweets to congratulate us. I thought it was a very nice touch. The room was very clean, modern and elegant, the bed was very large and comfortable, and it had a fantastic view of Tokyo Tower and a temple. Hotel provides free wifi and plenty of outlets for all your electronics. The staff is very courteous and thoughtful and very helpful with everything from handling your bags, providing directions, restaurant suggestions, and ideas for local sites to visit. While it's not within close walking distance to any major site, the hotel does offer a complimentary shuttle bus which runs frequent to and from the Hamamatsucho train station. From there, you can access the Tokyo metro. We really enjoyed our stay, and we would definitely choose the Prince Park Tower Hotel again in future trips to Tokyo.

This was the perfect location for our last night in Tokyo, with a staggering view of the Tokyo tower from our room, the bar and the restaurant.A very smart hotel, lovely room, super-comfy beds and everything we needed.And the lift's a delight, smooth as silk and alighting like a butterfly at the ground floor just above a water feature. Lovely!(Just one thing - if you're staying here, make sure you're not charged for a window seat in the bar - we were initially, and it was only thanks to a second member of staff who noticed the discrepancy that we were given a refund).

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days, split over 2 visits. The first room was amazing as we were upgraded, the room was large well laid out and had great features. The second room was normal (but good) as I think the hotel was busy. The room was large comfortable and had everything we needed, including a jacuzzi bath, which we needed after going up Fuji.We used the restaurants for breakfast and twice for dinner. We really appreciated the great service at the Japanese restaurant in the basement, they were lovely and made us feel welcome.My only gripe was that it was about £30 (4120 yen) to use the pool and spa, and this was a special rate.

This is a high class Tokyo hotel. Service is very good. There are many restaurants in the hotel but be prepared to pay a higher price than expected. The WiFi in the rooms is not very dependable. It is best to use the hard wire provided.

This hotel is world class it has everything that you could want, (i.e. in the lobby they have a room with automatic money exchanges you can put in any currency or travelers checks and it will exchange at current rates. This is the first time I had seen anything like this, you do not have to deal with anyone knowing how much money you exchange.) The rooftop bar and restaurant is a nice place to relax after a day of wondering around town. The breakfast is about what you would expect from a 5 star hotel, but you will fall in love with the French Toast and pouched eggs. Rooms are very large with all the room that you could ever want. I only stayed 5 days and they took care of me like I was one of their own grandfathers there was nothing that you could ask that they were not willing to help.

Highly recommended hotel, all the amenities associated with a five star hotel, the larger rooms are amazing, we particularly loved the Natural Spa situated near the swimming pool, we dined in two of the many restaurants both were very expensive, especially the rooftop bar and restaurant, but the views are worth it, the lifts facing the reception area are also pretty cool. This Hotel is very close and handy for the Tokyo Tower but it's a taxi ride for anything else nearby.I would definitely stay again.

Hotel is really lovely with helpful and polite staff - they make you feel special, like kings & queens. The rooms were big and had great views over the city. The toiletries in the beautiful bathroom, not to mention the supply of adaptors for your electrical gadgets were a very lovely surprise - definitely more than you'd get in other countries. The facilities, bakery, sky view restaurant, variety of other restaurants, bowling, supermarket etc. were fantastic. Just quite perfect. We had a room that overlooked the freeway, so the only spoiler is the noise from the traffic and emergency vehicles that you can hear at night. Also a convenient location from which to get around the city. You don't have to walk far to get to the nearest train station, or walk to the restaurant areas.

This was my second visit to the hotel, I choose to return to this property instead of the Imperial Hotel as I wanted that fantastic view at night, and I am a sucker for their French Toast served for breakfast, if you are not faint of heart! The staff, restaurants, and location were perfect for my purposes.
user_name:
FHSNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is one of the top hotels in Tokyo. It is located at the walking distance to Tokyo tower but away from main city centre. To explore the city you have to take the ungerdround train, the nearby station is at some distance from hotel. Before arriving at the hotel, i thought that the room will be quite small, but the room was spacious and full of amenities. Breakfast is served at the 33rd floor of the hotel where you can enjoy breakfast and panoramic view of the city. The hotel has free shuttle service to some destinations and pehaps for the Tokyo Narita airport. When you check in, request the hotel staff to offer you room at one of the higher floors,overlooking Tokyo tower, so you can enjoy panoramic view of Tokyo skyline and Tokyo tower.

We stayed here for our last night in Tokyo to be near the monorail to get us to Haneda. We just slept and didn't wat there. The room is nicely located in the park and within walking distance of bars and restaurants and subway. Good reception and professional service and a nice room looking over the Tokyo tower which is just beside hotel.The only negatives were that we tried to have a drink in the sky tower bar but were left waiting while various staff talked to each other on headsets but since we only wanted a drink we didn't wait too long before we left for a local bar where we got a nice pint of Bass. Also we were on 8th floor and there is a lot of traffic noise through the night so pack your earplugs. Also the shuttle to the monorail doesn't start until 8 am which was too late for us so we got a taxi outside. But overall I would recommend it as a place if you want to be close to transport to Haneda or outside the manic centre of Tokyo- which by the way was our favourite city in Japan.

We decided to stay at this hotel as it had the airport shuttle bus from Narita airport right to the door. The hotel is located beside the Tower and the Park but a bit far from the "lights of Toyko". We found the late check in a nuisance (not until 3pm), however they did store our bags. We did ask and they gave us our room at 2 pm so that was better. There isn't much to do close by. Check out is later though but if travelling that isn't much of a bonus. The room are very nice and large for Japan, beds very comfortable. Be careful to order smoking or non smoking rooms. There was a spa bath + a shower. Free WiFiWe had breakfast up on the top floor. The view, the variety and quality of breakfast was superb. It was top price though by Japanese standards.

We spent two days at the Prince Park Tower Hotel in Tokyo, at the beginning of our trip in Japan.It was a wonderful experience, as we were upgraded to a premier room, which had a beautiful view of the adjacent park. The view was through a wall of windows, and there was also a walkout balcony.The room exceeded our expectations in both beauty and size. It had both a walk in shower and bath, as well as a king size bed.It was remarkably clean, and we enjoyed eating at the restaurants. As expected, they are a little pricey-however you're enjoying fine dining at a luxury hotel in downtown Tokyo.I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who is looking for a first class experience while in Tokyo.It is next to the Tokyo Tower, as well as other common tourist destinations.

The facility of the hotel has one negative rule and that is tattoo. We know that tattoo are a taboo in Japan, but really. I went down to the swimming pool and the gym and nobody was using or swimming. Yet we couldn't be there because of my tattoo. We felt not very welcome because of that..This is our second prince Hotell this vacation. We chose it because it is central. So there for 4 stars/dots. With that said, the hotel is really nice and luxury. the employees are very kind and most respectful people :) restaurant with fantastic view to Tokyo tower or you can eat with the view of the city! Room-service and cleaning is great! We hope to come back next time and be welcome to the swimming pool and the gym. Hopefully the prince hotel will change the rule about tattoo. It's 2017 most tattoo are fashion.

Overall remarkable experience from check-in to check-out. Great value for phenomenal rooms. The on-property restaurants are a little spendy, but the quality is good and service is un-matched! Request a room with a view of the Tokyo Tower and you won't be disappointed.

A lovely hotel on the edge of the city.Just going through a refurbishment -so everything's fresh and new.A 5 minute car ride into town and the shops and the hustle and bustle of one of the great cities of the world.Staff helpful , service crisp and very clean and tidy facilities.Have breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor-its worth it .Table service , white table cloths , attentive staff.Good gym area and also pool and steam room. Relaxation area.Couldn't ask for more.

Large rooms friendly and good english service good location. Hotel is a bit older and pethaps not very glitzy but still a fine place to stay! Swimming pool and bowling ally alas for for adults only. Value forMoney, a bit in the expansive side but we had the very roomy garden suites and space is exoebsive in Tokyo!

The hotel is located very close to the Tokyo Tower, only a short walk. It's very close to public transport. Quite easy to travel into town, or around 20 min walk to Roppongi.Rooms are very spacious, well equipped for Tokyo and very clean. My room on the 5th floor faced the Tower and had a quaint balcony. There is a pretty park and temple next door.Bathroom is adequate and again very clean. Toilet has it's own room and is quite small. TV offerings were only Japanese. Staff were very friendly and nothing was ever a hassle. Breakfast was on the top floor with fantastic views across Tokyo. Food was very good.

A hotel located close to the Tokyo Tower which is not exactly down town, but on the other hand it is not very far from it. The hotel was undergoing renovation and therefore had a couple of lifts shut down for maintenance. This was visibly causing delays with the elevators. Excellent staff always willing to assist as well as all the restaurants that we visited while we dined in, where excellent. The room was quite big with nice view over Tokyo (30th floor). Breakfast was a feast and there was nothing missing from it. The bar at the roof offers magnificent view of the Tokyo tower and strangely enough it is possible to smoke as well. Sufficient adaptors for our electronics were placed in the room. TV channels mainly in Japanese, including of major News outlets such as CNN, BBC. The new rooms were looking much nicer than the one we had (from the photographs showing the new product) but the old ones were not looking tired and in need of renovation. Everything in working condition and looking good.

This hotel is in a convenient location for Public Transport (Train). The customer service at this hotel is excellent. Rooms are a good size and come in various layouts. Readily accessible beauty facilities, restaurants, gym and spa area. Use of the gym is at a cost and not part of your entitlement with the rooms. Great coach service to and from the hotel at a price which is better than the taxi cost. Great selection of meals especially breakfast. Centrally located for shopping and other facilities. Overall a great place for a family stay. Additionally the hotel caters for functions and large corporate events.
user_name:
Michael M
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: We stayed at King corner room with perfect view of Tokyo Tower for 3nights on 24th floor. We booked through booking.com(good deal) but upgraded at hotel for the Tokyo Tower view and high floor so please do if you want such view. The room is spacious and the bathroom is awesome with jacuzzi (after a long day soaking in was just right). Excellent service and the hotel is modern and new. Will stay again if in Tokyo. The location is great surrounding by park and shrines. Convenient stores and cool restaurants are in walking distances. We also asked the hotel 1month in advance for booking seats at Sukibayashi Jiro in ginza which they could get the deal for us.

The Prince Park Tower has a really nice lobby. We got some rainbow sandwich and it tasted so delicious. The service is so good, they were ready every second to help you. In the lobby there is a very pretty view of Tokyo Tower. The room we got for 3 people was actually for 2 persons. So the room was a little bit small but we could be there. The hotel has a good location, there are a lot of shopping centers to see near the hotel.

The Prince Park Tower has lovely, helpful staff. The neighborhood isn't particularly interesting although it is just a few minutes from the subway. The gym and pool each cost about $20 extra per use and close at 10 pm, which was disappointing.

A convenient location, 2 minute walk to the nearest station. Nice surrounding area. Close to Tokyo Tower. Rooms well appointed. Buffet breakfast on the observation floor was lovely each morning. Staff always helpful.

Wish I had more than one night to experience more of this hotel. Arrived late evening to be greeted with a great view of Tokyo Tower lit up at night. Excellent meal at the sky bar. Clean and comfortable room. Hotel is in a lovely park setting.

Stayed 4 nights, end of March 2017. (room 1002)On the good side:Excellent service, nice large room, comfortable but small bathroom, good location.On the bad side:Tiny restroom, small towels that saw better times, English almost not spoken, the SPA complex is not part of the hotel and a long walk to reach, not a functioning control of the air conditioning, breakfast - bad coffee, long wait for, and than only half a glass of orange juice ( a noisy manual machine operated by the staff)

Stayed in hotel for 2 nights and it's a short walk to Tokyo Tower. Arrived by airport bus that takes me to the hotel, however hotel didn't allow early check-in unless I pay for half day room rate. Wifi is free. Room is a little too old fashion to my liking but it is clean and room is big as compared to other hotels in Tokyo. Service is great and staff are friendly and helpful.

We had a great 3 night stay in this hotel in a corner king size room. The room was really spacious as far as tokyo standards go however we were disappointed to learn that the gym and spa facilities were pay per day and not included in our booking. The hotel has a great selection of restaurants however these were definitely overpriced. The staff were excellent and extremely helpful when we needed external restaurant reservations made in japanese. Good location, Roppongi is a good shopping and restaurant area.

Sits in a large park and next to a beautiful temple complex, a little old fashion but clean and with extremely attentive staff. The restaurants offer great food but come at a rather steep premium, if you are on a budget I would advise finding a ramen house in the surrounding area or better still a trip to the fish market. The bar on the 33rd floor has outstanding views but equally steep prices even for Tokyo.

This hotel is amazing! The staff are so friendly. So helpful. Very accomodating to my family's needs.The rooms are pure luxury also.Along with the sky lounge bar on the 33rd floor and the great restaurants.I love this hotel and my daughters can't stop talking about it.

It was great in all , friendly stuff, all well organized, beautiful room, breakfast is reach you'll find what to choose from for your taste and of course magnificent view on Tokyo, bar on top floor has an amazing view too especially evening time it's also the place you can smoke, excellent restaurants also one with the option where chef is cooking right in front of you. For girls I'll mention beauty services as well as La kowa nails it's bit pricey but worth it .

We've stayed at some really nice swanky hotels in our time (and some not so nice...) but the Prince Park Tower ranks among the highest. First impression of a hotel is usually the lobby. In other nice hotels we've been in the lobby is usually pretty opulent and warm. The Prince Park is a little different although no less impressive. I think this is intended as a business type hotel (although the room we got went well beyond that) however the business nature was indeed reflected in the lobby, which is mostly glass and metal with water features. It still makes quite the grand impression, but it is not the type of lobby you can comfortably lounge around in, this is not a complaint, as I said, it's very impressive. Staff were extremely efficient, polite and professional which is very typical of Japan, but staff here were even more professional somehow, they know their business and they do not mess around. We were upgraded to the premium level upon walking in and were told we could check in at the Club Lounge, so instead of standing around at the front desk we were able to take the elevator up to something like the 29th floor where a spacious and light seating area awaited us, complete with chairs and small tables, fancy food laid out, a variety of beverages and an astonishing full window view of Tokyo Tower. A staff member came up shortly thereafter and checked us in while we sat in comfortable chairs eating salmon hors d'oeuvres. This was a new and wonderful experience for us. We had access to this lounge for our whole stay, I believe. The room was unlike any other I've stayed in, very swanky yet super comfortable and very spacious especially for Tokyo. The overall feel was one of tasteful modern design and simple casual elegance. There was an area with a standing sink, partially enclosed in wood with a large mirror, and a counter with various soaps and lotions and such, where one could freshen up. This was in addition to the shower room, so one person could be showering and the other could be brushing their teeth or whatever in this separate area, which is a nice touch. Additionally, the toilet itself is in it's own separate little room. The front wall of the shower room was all glass, which added a swanky modern touch, so long as you're not shy and you could take in the incredible view whilst showering. Outside of the shower room is a spacious nook with a bench under a rod with hangers, a nice place to hang your clothes and such. The bed is huge and very comfortable, it was like sleeping on a cloud. Except of course you'd just fall through a cloud but maybe you know what I mean. It was super comfortable. One side of the room is pretty much all window with a spectacular view of Tokyo. There's a very small terrace you can step out onto, maybe just enough space for two or three people to stand, and you can feel the building swaying slightly out there, pretty cool. Easily one of the nicest rooms we've ever stayed in. There are 7 different restaurants in the hotel as well as a few lounges and a bakery. We only ate at the Japanese restaurant, Shibazakura, for breakfast and the sushi restaurant, Hamashiba, for dinner. To be honest, the breakfast was all right but we'd had a much better one at a ryokan up in the mountains, but the sushi...Ok, the sushi dinner is not cheap, however the level of quality is downright indescribable, the only word I can think of is "exquisite". I've never had sushi that good and may never again. Service was quiet, graceful and extremely efficient. Hands down one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. We also checked out the Stellar Garden Sky Lounge which was very cool for it's up close glowing night view of Tokyo Tower but unfortunately wasn't a place we could spend much time in due to the cigarette smoke. Definitely worth stopping in and getting a drink though. At the end of our stay the staff were, as usual, very efficient, helpful and informative about arranging our transport out of there. This was an absolutely perfect stay, one of the finest we've ever experienced. I felt like James Bond, I can offer no better ringing endorsement.

We have stayed here for four nights when visited Tokyo. The hotel is very nicely done, the rooms are a bit small (okay... in Tokyo all the rooms are small...). The location is not outstanding but they have a metro stop nearby, so it makes things easy. Tokyo tower is just one step away! I must point out that the staff is exceptional. They are really nice! We had a good time here. A bit expensive.

So the rooms are comfortable and clean. They're slightly dated but nothing wrong with them. The best part of my stay was having breakfast on the 33rd floor over looking Tokyo Tower. It's a great view and pretty nice breakfast buffet for Yen 3400++For what I paid I thought it was good value for money using Hotels.com

Tokyo is so large that it is difficult to know where to stay. We were only here for three days and decided on the Prince Park Tower hotel. This is a very good hotel and the staff are very friendly. We stayed in a Park Suite which was perfect for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The breakfast buffet set us up for the day and from the restaurant you have a good view of Mt Fuji. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from a metro stop and even though the metro and underground train map initially looks impossible to understand we had mastered it after a day or two. From the hotel you can get all over the city easily with the public transport. Also good access for the Haneda airport via the monorail which stops 15 mins walk from the hotel.

Intro:We stayed here on our very first visit to Tokyo. Not having any experience of the city and what it has to offer this seemed nice and a safe choice. Getting to the hotel:We took the Narita Express to Shibuya which takes approx. 80 minutes and then the metro. I highly recommend sorting out your return ticket for the Narita Express immediately or the day before your going back. The queues can be super long and please allow for plenty of time for the trip to the airport! The Location:The location is not the best to be honest. Compared to what Tokyo has to offer, it’s in a very quiet neighborhood. And when you add the “resort”-feelting to it, it get even more secluded.  The Room:I was very surprised by the room, it’s a bit out of date but it was quite big. The room had huge windows that gave the room a more spacious vibe and gave a super nice view of the city. Ask for a room that faces the park or the Tokyo Tower! Unique details:As I wrote before, the hotel has a real “resort” vibe going on. They have a bakery and s small supermarket in the lobby. It also has some restaurants and bars as well. Good to know:The walk from the metro takes about 20 minutes. Not as close as we thought. What’s close by:Nothing exciting as a first time visitor. Luckily the metro is extensive, but I highly recommend living in the more busier areas such as Shibuya, Omotesando, Harajuku or Shinjuku. Customer Service:Very limited English skills, but very polite. Overall impression:The hotel is actually nice, if it was 1975. The resort-feeling is really not what we were after.

Prince Park Tower Tokyo is located right next to Tokyo Tower, as the name already suggests. It's location is useful for business travellers visiting nearby offices. Depending on the weather you could work (20-30 mins) but it's also easy to get a taxi. The rooms are very clean, spacious enough but do start to look a little dated. Renovations are underway.Staff are extremely friendly and helpful, speaking good English. Chinese restaurant in the basement has nice food but is fairly pricey. Would visit again should business bring me to the area again.

Stayed here after staying at the prince sakura. Both hotels are owned by the same company. This hotel needs a face lift. The prince sakura looks like it had just been renovated where the prince park towers rooms are in need of new furniture and carpeting. The decor in the restaurant is hideous but the view is beautiful as are the views from the rooms. I could see tokyo tower and much of the city from my room on one of the upper floors.. Get the panoramic corner king room and you will love the view. This hotel is also within a 5 minute walk to a subway station although you cant catch the jr line there. Lastly the housekeeping is amazing.

Nice hotel at good Location. Near Metro . Room are spacious and well equipped .Prices are at the high side especially since mostly without bf . Hotel has in house convenient store where you can buy all items for BF. Airport Shuttle Bus Connection. Need to Reserve ticket

Splendid view ! You can view the park & the tower.You wake up in the morning seeing a green scenario and the metallic tower.And at night the tower lightens up!Everything is clean.The staff were very helpful and very friendly.We took the average standard room.The size of the room was not small nor too big. You still have space and move a bit in the room.I liked that the toilet was separated from the bathroom. The bath amenities were provided by Shiseido (like most Japanese hotels).The area where the hotel was located is peaceful and calm. There is no noise at night.Too bad we haven't tried the restaurants in the hotel.But we ate some good pizza in Tokyo tower if anyone is wondering.There is a station with 5 ~ 7 min walking distance.And the hotel provides a shuttle to another station ( I forgot it's name ).If you want to be near Shibuya or Shinjuku ( or areas that are so lively at night ) then I don't recommend the prince park tower Tokyo.

A very good business hotel by the Tokyo Tower. I recommend you to splurge and get the room with Tokyo Tower view. Really worth it as you get to see the view from your bed both day and night. My room is on the 19th floor..not the newly renovated one so the design was just so so but you have everything you need in the room; good TV, comfy bed, shower, bathtub, minibar, working desk, lounge chair, balcony and the view to die for.

This is a quality hotel in a good location. It is located adjacent to Tokyo Tower which is good for getting your bearings when walking. Shrine and Shiba are close by. Rooms are spacious and clean. Service is excellent and the hotel restaurants and facilities are excellent although expensive. Indeed the hotel is expensive although deals can be had in certain times of the year through hotel booking sights.

We stayed for just one day at the end of our 'Sakura' trip in April and had a comfortable and enjoyable stay at the Prince Park Tower. The hotel has a quiet but fairly central spot with easy reach to downtown and central Tokyo attractions, shopping and restaurants. The staff was friendly makes we felt welcome and cared & the room was nice and spacious. Highly recommended!

Nice hotel in a convenient location. Some tourist areas were walkable. Train station was very close. Rooms were nothing special. Small TV which was somewhat outdated. Only CNN and BBC as English stations with Japanese audio overdubbed (couldn't figure out how to turn that off). Shower was great and bathroom was sizable. Beds were soft and comfortable. Probably would go elsewhere next time.

We stayed for just one day at the end of our Japan tour in April and had a comfortable and enjoyable stay at the Prince Park Tower. Situated right in the beautiful Shiba Park, the hotel has a quiet but fairly central spot with easy reach to downtown and central Tokyo attractions, shopping and restaurants. The room was nice and reasonably spacious despite the extra bed we needed in the room. The staff was friendly and courteous and despite the short time we spent there, we felt welcome and cared for which makes any stay that much more enjoyable. Definitely a quality hotel which I will recommend to families and business visitors alike. If anything, the only minor negative was the rather long time it took to check-in and to check-out.
user_name:
Okay B
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Great location near Tokyo radio tower. The hotel superb breakfast and room facilities, mostly recommended! Located in the center of the minato district. Has a shuttle to the train station - we enjoyed our stay there enormously!

The location is next to Tokyo tower where you can see it day or night without anything blocking the view. Overall the design of the room feel a little bit old but im okay. The walk to the gym area is like 5 mins journey.

Once a year I stay at this hotel. I like everything from there. Nice , clean Bathroom with view, comfy bed, good service, the best breakfast at top flower with tower view, clean and excellent pool,the best SPA, many good bar. I always rather to go back there. The best restroom in the world.

We stayed in Prince Park Tower Hotel for 1 night in April 2017 at the end of our trip to Japan. It is a modern hotel with all the typical facilities that one would typically expect. From a location perspective, we felt that the other hotel we had stayed at in Tokyo (in Ginza area) during our Japan trip was better and more convenient.

Stayed here for two nights - had stayed in a smaller hotel earlier in the week but switched when we came back to Tokyo. Why? Mainly because I needed to hang out in my room and a wanted easy access back to the airport. Most hotels in Tokyo are TINY - I mean you can practically reach out and touch both walls but not here! The rooms are BIG, clean and spacious - my bathroom here was the size of my entire last room! My room had a jacuzzi tub and a shower, the best pillows I had in all of Japan and a great view! I loved the area, there was a small park and a temple and the views of Tokyo tower at night are speechless. Access to the subway is easy from here and of course, there are taxis lined up in front. Service was over the top and the place was spotless. My Japanese friends say they stay here sometimes when they come to town. Highly recommend.

I booked this hotel for our last night in Japan. Nothing much to say. The hotel is according to it standard and the value is good for the money. Unfortunately, we didn't enjoy much our stay as we spent our last day visiting Tokyo and had to wake up very early for our flight. So we just spent few hours for sleep only in the hotel.Anyway, room are big, comfortable beds, good and large bathroom, excellent wifi.I didn't believe when I booked the hotel that the view will be so nice as the photo in the website. But yes, our room was facing the Tokyo tower and the beautiful park!

We stayed for 3 nights and the hotel and staff very nice. Breakfast with a choice of restaurants was excellent.Rooms just ready for refurbishment but clean. The staff are really good and can't do enough for you. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from underground station.The Stella bar although expensive has great views with a vast choice of drinks and cocktails. Biggest gripe is they allow smoking in the bar and you come out smelling of smoke which is a real shame as probably only 10 percent of people were smoking with 100 percent of people having to suffer the smell.

Stayed for 6 nights overall as part of a group of 24. Efficient check-in and check-out both times and good service overall. The rooms are well appointed and spacious, some have separate toilet, others have balcony and two bathrooms- as a group we had a mixture of everything.There is a choice of 3 breakfast restaurants, buffet, American set menu and Japanese set menu. Tried all 3 and all good. Only negative were the extra charge of over 2000 JPY (£20!) for the eggs benedict (if breakfast not included, this menu was over £40!!! A rather pricey breakfast for a regular dish otherwise elsewhere included) and the sometimes long wait (ok, about 15 minutes- long when on a tight schedule) for a table at the buffet breakfast, when lots of tables were available but just not cleared fast enough. However, the food and drinks were very good and the coffee nice and strong- with a choice of expresso, cappuccino etc.There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel.The metro is a short walking distance from the hotel making exploring Tokyo easy. There is a regular shuttle bus to the train station and to the airport too but we didn't use it so not sure of costs.We didn't have time to try the spa and the other facilities on site but was surprised to find the hotel doesn't offer any changing room and shower facilities for those leaving Japan late in the evening. Whilst they store luggage after check-out until departure, the only option of a changing room and shower before what would be very long journey home for most travellers, is the showers at the spa but for a charge of just over 2000 JPY- a rather very expensive shower. Needless to say I didn't avail of this offer but instead found that the toilets at the airport have changing rooms- for free.

The hotel looks nothing special from the outside. The rooms and service were very good. It even had a separate bath and shower which is a luxury in Tokyo. It is. Very near Tokyo Tower and one of the main shrines in Tokyo. Breakfast is expensive, but there is a coffee shop and bakery not too far, near the temple. The rooms are very well equipped and have everything you need. My last day there, I was in a mad rush with many meetings planned. Forgot my passport and travel wallet in the safe. I only realised when I was checking into my next hotel at about 22:00. Called the hotel and the concierge very kindly offered to drive them over to the new hotel (another Prince) after his shift. Amazing service.

My Husband and I had dinner at Restaurant Brise Verte on the top of The hotel last night to celebrate my birthday.My husband had communicated the concierge, Ms. Mayumi Kimura, she took great initiatives to make our celebration special. She took our diet request and informed the restaurant team in advance, so even we wanted to decide our menu on the spot, the restaurant staff was really turned on to offer us alternatives play by ear basis.  Also she took her lead to decorate our table very nicely with flower, petals, and candles to create more romantic moment with a magnificent view of Tokyo. Another special thanks to Mr. Kenichi Uchizawa's (Assistant Manager of the restaurant) warm, attentive, hospitality together with his team. He made our dinner more relaxing, feel more entertained with his friendly, yet professional interaction. We would like to say thank you to all of their staffs, however, we do not have all of their names... The last but not least, food was fantastic! French cuisine, with olive oil created modern, healthy taste.The hotel and the Restaurant is highly recommended for your important occasions!Mari & Andreas Adorjan

This hotel is wonderful. Its a bit south of the action in Tokyo, but thats what we liked. 2 blocks from the Shibakoen subway, next to the Tokyo tower and very quiet. The hotel is huge with lots of amenities like spa, restaurants, fitness center, shops and convenient store. The staff is excellent and the rooms are so well equipped. Amazing value. The restaurant at the top has incredible views and the breakfast buffet is stunning.

I stayed for five days, and the hotel is very comfortable, simply and well decorated. The room which I stayed was big enough and had all the ammenities that you need: two single beds, a desk, two great armchairs with a coffe table and TV. The only defect that I've found is that TV doesn't have any internstional channel. But, of course, I'd suggest this hotel.

Park Tower is well located at the edge of a park and reasonably close to a subway station. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, the breakfast buffet generous and with a hefty view included. The hotel has also many facilities, gym etc. For us, the top was the panoramic bar with very good cocktails and a breath taking view of Tokyo by night with Tokyo Tower right in front of your nose. Take a stool behind the bar, if you are close to the window you pay more for the drinks. I was there with my family, this is not a family hotel but my kids felt on top of the world. The airport shuttle is a plus.

Great hotel, views are amazing, especially at night. Staff speak good English and are very professional.We had a corner suite, not the tower view, still was awesome to see all the city lights at night.Buffet breakfast was ok, view was the best part. Fantastic pastry and fresh juice selection.Bed was very comfy, especially after ryokan stays prior to this.Bathroom is very spacious and has quality products, bath itself has jacuzzi setting, so relaxing.Free shuttle to Hamamatsucho JR station, subway is closer. Found location to be just ok, personal preference matter though, so if you are visiting things in the area I guess it works. Stayed in Shibuya and Shinjuku last time and found these areas to be more convenient. This is a great option was a few nights stopover though, Shiba park being on the hotels doorstep.

The hotel is absolutely fantastic, spacious rooms, clean bathroom, excellent service , very good wi_fi, lovely location and views. We stayed for 4 days and highly recommend it. The closest subway station is about 5 minutes by walk.

I stayed there on our first day at Tokyo. Very nice hotel with friendly and politely staffs. The room view at night was very awesome. You can look though the window and the view of skyscrapers out side the room. On the top of 33th floor,you can enjoy with the very tasty breakfast in the morning with have many choices. Highly recommended!

The Prince Park Tower Hotel is offering a nice accomodation with spacious rooms and a very friendly service in a central Location near Roppongi and in the vincinity of the Tokyo Tower. Two subway stations are in a walking distance and the shuttle bus to Hamamatsucho is very coinvient to Access either the central Yamanote Line or the Monorail to Haneda. The Hotel has got Japanese, Chinese and Western Restaurants, which offer very reasonable lunch menues. For breakfast you can choose between American, Japanese and Buffet style. Buffet style is very good with many different dishes, freshly squize orange Juice and many freshly baked pasteries. The view from the bar on the top floor is outstanding. All in all a place to recommend and to come back.

It was my second stay at the Prince Park Tower Hotel and it did not disappoint. A spacious corner room with view at Tokyo Tower, the fantastic location in the middle of Shiba Park, the Gym and the conference center. The Stellar Garden bar and the many nice restaurants in Minato-Ku right next to the park rounded up the pleasant experience. One of the highlights: on the weekend the concierge provided us with a complete map and train schedule how to get to Hakone Onsen. Will come again soon. *****

Beautiful and clean room. Staff were all very polite, friendly and found an English doctor for us when my bf was ill. The view from the room was spectacular. Nice complimentary snack for birthday. Will recommend this hotel to everyone. The location of the hotel was great and had a shutter bus straight to the airport. The room rates were expensive for the view of the tower. Overall perfect experience. Well done to all the staff who helped us they showed great team work and enthusiasm to their job like no other hotel.

Great esxperiemce im Tokyo. Great view from our room and access to the lounge wasa greta option fot a sunset drink or mornig breakfast option!!!The room's amenities were fantastic and the personel very kind and attentive.Would stay here again

I and my colleague visited Tokyo in the first week of March and we stayed for a total of 4 nights. Hotel is in the city centre and just a stone throw from tokyo tower. Rooms are of good size and very clean. Check in process is very efficient. They make you sit and do the check in process. Luggage is delivered alongwith you and the bell boy (girl) comes with you and drops off the baggage. They have choices of breakfast at different restaurants - japanese, american set breakfast, and normal buffet breakfast with a good spread of both continental and vegetarian options (though more vegetarian options are recommended). I liked green smoothie. If you stay at the hotel, do not miss out the spa with natural spring. Its quite reasonable and offers good facility. Strongly recommended for those who would like to be in the city centre.

Great hotel with nice service at front desk and upon arrival. The hotel has all you can ask for. Try the great Japanese restaurants at bottom floor. They are serving perfect food and nice people. Stay at the premium side of the hotel it will be quiet with fantastic view of Tokyo.

Booked this hotel solely on the basis of TA reviews, having never been to Tokyo before and it very much lived up to expectations. Good location in a park with plenty of green space. The hotel itself is just huge but you are in Tokyo so get used to 'big'! We stayed twice during our trip and second time got a room on the 23rd floor which had great views and lots of light. Ate at the rooftop Brise Verte for New Years Eve dinner (disappointing) and a couple of breakfasts (great) at the Torishiba Yakitoori restaurant (good) and the Lobby lounge (sounds terrible but actually very nice). Special mention for the concierge services which were excellent. Only regret was that we did not have enough time to use the bowling alley!

I enjoyed the stay overall, but was a little disappointed with the decor in my room, it was very 1980s. That said it was very spacious (I had a corner king room) and there was every amenity you could ask for. The premium lounge is well worth it, free-flow champagne during the evening happy hour!!

I stayed here for 3 weeks.Close to subway.Ask for a room with a view of the tower (you might have to beg)the breakfasts are great. You can choose from Japanese or Western.Fantastic view while eating as well.The bathroom had a Jacuzzi bathtub and nice toiletry amenities provided daily.There is a shrine right next door and a nice safe are to walk around and restaurants.

Next to Tokyo Tower and close by subway also have green bushes in garden along Jinsha to have a glance of local culture. Lots good place to eat and drink, just fab to walk around and sample good food after busy day!

We really enjoyed our stay at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo. It was conveniently located, clean, and elegant. We found the room to be a nice size compared to others in Japan and thought it was priced very competitively. The staff were helpful and spoke perfect English. We would stay again.

The hotel is located at the south end of Shiba park, which gives it a great view all around. It is also close to Tokyo Tower, so that was an easy landmark to head for when coming out of Hamamatsucho station. It was about 15-20 minutes' walk from Hamammatsucho, which is linked directly to Haneda airport via the Tokyo monorail.The hotel has an east entrance which is the most convenient when coming from Daimon station. It looks quite nondescript, next to the gate of Daitokuin, but leads underground and connects to the main tower, walking past a bowling alley, boutiques for both kimono and clothes, and other hotel amenities.The rooms are large and well laid out, and with enough space for a large writing desk. There are 2 banks of lifts, which serve different floors. The higher floors require card access to reach the lifts. The lifts are bubble-type lifts which open to the interior of the building. The atrium is tall and impressive, especially with the lighted lifts going up and down.The rooms basically face 3 different directions; north, southeast towards Rainbow bridge and the morning sun, and southwest. My view was to the southwest which faces a traffic intersection.Had breakfast both at the Japanese restaurant in the basement, and buffet breakfast on the 32nd floor. Both are good, with the Japanese restaurant being quieter, and the buffet with a wider range of food. There was also an egg station where omelettes could be cooked to order.There is a free shuttle bus which runs every half hour to Hamamatsucho station, but to get in from the station, you would have to know where to wait for it.

Hotel exceed all my expectations in my most recent trip.. I have stayed in other hotels like the Four Seasons Tokyo and have to say i was won over by the wonderful service and hospitality at the Prince Park. Had a corner room in the club room floor which was recently renovated and provided me access to the lounge and all of their services. Staff was helpful in setting up private car service, breakfast and happy hour was nice with great views of Tokyo Tower. My new go to hotel when visiting Tokyo.

I was kind of pensive about getting to this hotel- first time in Tokyo and arriving around 8pm from HK. Wasnt difficult from Haneda Airport (Monorail through to Daimon Station and a short walk with a heavy suitcase to the Hotel).Staff friendly at checkin. Took me to my room on the 23rd floor and showed me how to operate the Orfura (hot bathtub complete with autofill and three speed bubbles), the internet and the automatic curtain system. Wonderful view over the Tokyo tower from my corner room. TV has dual language function that they also showed me how to use.Breakfast on the 33rd floor with expansive views over Tokyo. Great selection of food- plus fresh juices made on demand. Coffee and green tea both excellent.Gym- the gym a HUGE PLUS. Not enough details on the website or also on TripAdvisor about the gym- but rest assured, its fully equipt with Technogym equiptment from Italy. Includes a Smith machine, cross cable machine, a variety of one exercise machines, free weights. You need to pay 2000yen to use the gym, but its super worthwhile.Location is handy to the Zojo-ji temple, Shiba park and the Tokyo Tower and two seperate stations on two different lines- JR Line and Oenda Line.

My daughter and I stayed at the Prince Park Hotel in Tokyo for our last 2 nights. Maybe I feel so positive about this hotel because we had stayed the 2 nights before at a Ryokan in Kyoto- but must say their beds looked like heaven. The customer service here was the absolute best we experienced in Japan. One of their staff, Amy, was particularly charming and helpful- even though we were only there 2 days she treated us like old friends.The room was great, with a spectacular view of the Tokyo tower from our window. The beds were comfy with 2 nice sized pillows. The bathroom was very nice- with a jacuzzi bath tub. The shower was marvelous as well with great water pressure.One of the nicest things about the hotel was that it was so established. We took a cab several times, and all we had to say was "Prince Park" and the cab drivers knew it immediately ( which is great if, like me, you don't speak Japanese and have a hard time giving directions.)On our last day there we had a flight scheduled back to Los Angeles at 7:20 pm. Room service was happy to bring our breakfast at 10:30 and extend our checkout until 1 pm free of charge. We decided to go shopping for a few hours after checking out. Amy was happy to hold our luggage for us, and arranged for a car to take us to the airport when we returned.Next time I go to Japan I will certainly be booking this hotel again.

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. There are great facilities (spa and swimming pool) and the boulangerie has a great selection of breads and pastries. The hotel staff are very friendly and the room was beautiful. The hotel is located very close to Tokyo Tower and the Zojo-Ji temple and it is easy to access other parts of Tokyo via the underground: Gion, Shinjuku, Imperial Palace.

This is a really first class hotel. Our room was large with well furnished and an amazing view over the park and Tokyo Tower. Breakfast was taken on the top floor restaurant with views over Tokyo city. There are a number of restaurants in the hotel but very high prices you are better to go into the city for food. Did try room service for Dinner one night which was very good and we sat enjoying the fabulous views from our room. There is a shop/supermarket in the hotel selling everything from sandwiches and drinks to gifts. Very useful if you are touring to be able to pick something up before leaving in the morning. The staff were very friendly and as always in Japan efficient.

Had a fantastic stay in this luxury hotel. Very helpful staff who could not do enough to help out with any questions I had for them.If you can upgrade to a corner room for even better all round views of the tower which looks even better at night! The hotel surrounded by parks to chill out in.Station very close by.Recommend this hotel highly in you need a few days stop over in Tokyo.

The Prince Park Tower is a great hotel, with a price tag to show for it.Arriving at Hamamatsucho subway station, on the Yamanote line, you can either take a taxi to the hotel (around 800 yens depending on traffic) or go downstairs to bus bay 5 and take the Hotel shuttle for free. The bus times are shown by the bay.It is an imposing building, right by Tokyo tower, surrounded by embassies, a lovely park with a shrine, and 900 yens taxi ride to Roppongi Hills’ shopping and restaurant area.The hotel has a top floor bar ‘Stellar Garden’ (it isn’t guaranteed you will get to seat by the side of Tokyo tower) with amazing views of the city, a café and several restaurant. They are on the pricey side. To give you an example, on New Year's eve we stopped at the bar for one glass (not a pint size) of beer and one glass of sake with soda, spending 3847 Yens - £28 at the time of writing. (the table charge was 1020, and it was discounted because we were hotel guests). However, there is also a fantastic shop on the ground floor, which is like a Family Mart where you can get food, alcohol, snacks, drinks, pastries, coffee for your room, etc. If, like us, you have been in Japan for a couple of weeks by this point, you may wish to eat in your room for a change, so this types of shops are truly heaven sent. The fridge in the room is already full (and you will see the price difference between those drinks and the ones from the shop downstairs), so make yourself some space and use the fridge for your stuff.You can also take the free shuttle to the station, and explore the area around there: there are plenty restaurants and even an Irish bar, all at a more restraint costs, than in the hotel. Alternatively, once the shuttle drops you off, you are only two stops away from the main train stations (Tokyo, Shinagawa, Shibuya, etc.) and each of them offers food, food and more food.Our room had a huge window on two sides – pretty spectacular – though it meant that once the sun was up the room turned into an oven, and the aircon was not the most efficient (a definite downside). The bathroom has a large shower and a large bathtub, plus all the amenities. There is free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. The staff is great and efficient.The limousine bus transfer to Narita goes from the hotel, so you can get to the airport for 3100 Yens per person (if you still have your JR Pass use it to get on the Narita Express for free).They have an onsen/spa for an extra charge, a bowling alley and a karaoke room too. They organised a lovely countdown event in their private garden for new Year’s night with the guests being entertained by live music, sipping hot sweet drinks and releasing white helium balloons in the air at the bell– and given that there are no fireworks on the night, anywhere, it was a nice thing to do. After midnight you can then make your way to the nearby temples as per traditional Japanese custom. Overall it’s certainly a great hotel.

We stayed at the Prince Park for 3 nights, rooms were great and very spacious. Sky garden on level 33 was phenomenal, there is a $10aud cover however the views are spectacular and is well worth a visit '

I had an incredible 5 star experience at this hotel! This was my second trip to Tokyo in the past year. I stayed at a well known 5 star hotel last time and expected less from this hotel because it was not consistently rated a 5 star property and it was less expensive. I checked many sites and it was typically rated a 4 or 4.5 star hotel. I was happy to be so incredibly wrong. I got so much more, not less!! This hotel exceeded my expectations in every possible way. I actually preferred The Prince Park Tower Tokyo to the very expensive, well known 5 star hotel, I stayed at the previously. I loved the beautiful location, the wonderful breakfast, which was a combination of Japanese and western food. The rooms were quiet, impeccably clean, modern and spacious. The service this hotel offered could not of been better. It started off with exceptional customer service from Rosalie, who checked us in and walked us up to our rooms. That exceptional, personal service from Rosalie and the entire staff never ended. The rooms, the gift shop, the restaurants, were all beautiful, modern, clean and and very well maintained. I found my Tokyo hotel and look forward to staying there again!

Awesome, wonderful, everything was great since arrival through checkout. Checkin: was quick and smooth, great attention and good english. They gave us free breakfast tickets (GREAT, THANK YOU), I think it was because my Expedia status. They also gave us some amenities for my kid.Breakfast: We tried both options, asian breafast and buffet at Panorama 33. Asian was really good, you can choose fish or chicken, with some side dishes including rice, soup, fruit, seaweed and others. Buffet at Panorama 33 was wonderful, with a lot of options to every taste and a great view of Tokyo Tower. Also you can have a really quick breakfast at bakery.Dining: You have a lot of options, casual bakery and fine restaurantsConvenience Store: Near lobby you can find a lot of useful stuff.Transportation: Really near you can find Akabanebashi and Shibakoen stations. Akabanebashi is the best options, since you can connect easily to more destinations. Also you can take the free shuttle to Hamamatsusho Station, usefull to take JR trains.Room: Big and clean. A lot of bathroom amenities, coffes and tea mekers, refrigerator and a sofa with a great city view to relax. Comfortable beds and really good blackout curtains.Airport transportation: you can book the airport limousine with stablished times both to Narita and Haneda. This is a really cheap and convenient option. You can also charge this service to your room account.They also have a tourist services desk, where you can book a lot of tours.And you can´t forget to visit The Zojoji Temple, just a few steps from the hotel. It´s a great authentic experience, much better than Asakusa tourist hustle. Also is a great option to buy cheap souvenirs.All in all, we are very happy with this Hotel, and we will come back for sure. Thank you for this great experience.

My 2nd visit to Tokyo since my last trip was back in 1988.This hotel is located very very Near to Tokyo Tower and can get a good view of it every night you walk back to the hotel.The 33th Floor where you can have your breakfast will also gives you a day view of the tower and surrounding.There are a couple of small eating place around the hotel, or you can always pop into the Family Mart and grap some of those pre cook and ready to eat once you heat it up.We got a connecting room but didn't manage to get King / Queen bed for the 2 pax room. They only provide complimentary water for the 1st day, so you have to boil your water or buy them.Love the toilet bowl, it's automated, warm all time and open up (hands free) when you open the toilet door. Staff are friendly and helpful, was asking them if there is any coin operated laundry and they found it and came to me with a map.Over all nice place to stay beside the price is a little high, of coz is due to the peak season of year end...

We booked this place as an add-on to a study tour in Japan. We got it for an exceptional price, and was treated to so much more. Service was exceptional, as were the rooms. We were highly impressed by all aspects of this hotel, with easy access to local stations, as well as being next to a major Tokyo landmark itself. Definitely worth the stay.

The hotel is located well near subway stations and in front of a nice Park. Staff is very friendly, rooms are well equipped with very large beds and a balcony. I was given a room with view towards the Park which was vey nice, as I had the skyline of Tokyo in front of me. Breakfast is very expensive, cheaper is the room device in case of a smaller breakfast. The only critic is that the use of the gym is not included and one has to pay extra. Weird for a hotel.

After 3 weeks travelling, mainly in Air BnB apartments we decided to treat ourselves to a nice hotel on our last night.The room was very spacious for Tokyo standards, and It felt like the bathroom was bigger than some of the apartments we'd stayed in!!We were lucky enough to be upgraded - big thanks to the hotel - the room was wonderful.View was fantastic, overlooking the Tokyo tower, then in the morning we could see Mt Fuji in the distance.We were only there for 1 night, so I'm not sure how much there is in the local area, but the hotel is within 5 mins walk of 2 different metro stations, on 2 different lines so plenty of easy transport links.Front desk & concierge were all great. The only downside of the hotel I noticed was the bar on the top floor had a 1000+ Yen per person cover charge - I think the cover charge should be waived for guests. There is another bar in a basement level, but it's not really the same....Apart from that it was a very nice hotel.

Situated not far away from Haneda airport, this hotel is very nice. Mainly for business with very helpful front desk. Terrific view for breakfast at the 30th floor, very nice international breakfast, with multiple choices. Room are up to standard, very confortable with nice bad and shower room. I stayed only 2 nights for business, so didn't have the time to see spa and swimming pool, nor surroundings, but would stay there again.

Stayed for one week in Oct for business. The room or even the bathroom were spacious by Tokyo standard. Front desk and concierge were English friendly. If you happen to book the room with the view of the tower, the view is magnificent.The location itself might be a bit far from the buzz, but it offers a quiet and upscale ambience instead. There is a convenient store within the hotel, so you don't have to worry about missing something and having to run back into town.Room service was also excellent, quality of food is always guaranteed. Can miss the Stellar Garden with a glass or two at night!
