Backs up to the Shibakoen park, which is lovely. Maybe 20-min walk to Yarukacho or Roppongi. Close to several metro stops - but none that connect to Tokyo Station.

I stayed at both the Prince Park and the Grand Hyatt during my stay. Both are fabulous. The Prince is not quite as fancy, but not far off, and the rooms are appreciably larger. The other main difference is in the location. If not being in the heart of shopping and restaurants is okay with you, it is a very worthy choice and you will save 20-50%. The staff is fabulous, very helpful.

I stayed here while on business in the district. The hotel is situated within a park in a nice suburb of Tokyo, near the Tokyo Tower and very close to public transport. It is about a 12 minute walk from the Hamamatsucho monorail station which has a direct connection to Haneda Intl. Airport (20 mins). So access from Haneda is easy. Hotel has a paid shuttle to both Narita and Haneda upon reservation. The hotel itself is very large with extensive conference facilities. I was given a corner suite at check-in. The suite was very large. The decor and furnishings are a bit dated (1980s) but were in good condition. Housekeeping was excellent with great attention to detail and to cleanliness. The room was spotless. Large selection of toiletries and amenities. Always topped up each day.The staff were all really great. The level of service was very high indeed. Staff always polite.Breakfast is served on the 33rd floor with amazing views. The selection is good although I missed not having dairy produce and not having much fruit.There are a number of restaurants. I tried the steakhouse (very, very expensive). There are fitness facilities for an additional fee, even for hotel guests. The pool is a good size. Gym is reasonable and you can rent gear. Sauna and hot mineral spring pool available. Very nice changing facilities. Note, you cannot use any of these facilities if you have tattoos.I went running to the Imperial Palace. Popular running route in the mornings. Shorter jogging routes shown on a map issued by concierge.Overall, good hotel, great staff, good facilities, good location. Would choose this hotel again.

Nice hotel with lovely rooms and breakfast BUT you cannot get a drink in any bar tonight despite being a resident. 9.45 and having to go to bed...hows that for tokyo. A walk out to another bar not really practical in this location. Very very disappointed.

This is a pretencious place. Perfect for arrogant rich people. Did I like it? Of course. The whole wall is a huge window and the bathroom is huge. This place is perfect, yet, i can't stand places like this. Yet, i love them.Price for a night: as much as a kidney. You've been warned.

For the price a very decent hotel. The location is good to explore the city and the rooms are spacious and nice. The service is mediocre and you got to pay for all stuff extra (like gym).The metro system is close to the hotel.

We actually relocated here from Ginza and were really pleased we did. Upgraded to a 1br suite the outlook over the park and city from the 14th floor a welcome relief. The extra breathing space much appreciated. Walking distance to JR and some decent cafes and restaurants nearby, the park and less busy streets make this hotel a great choice for Tokyo. Room decor is a little dated though clean, functional and well appointed. Room cleaning and reception staff are very friendly, professional and helpful. Give it a go.

Room was for 3 people, we got 1 bedroom with 2 doubles and a sofa bed in the lounge. Rooms were huge, but still homely in a hotel way. Views were superb over the park.Service was sublime as per Japanese standards.The hotel even let us store a surfboard there for the week while we took a trip to the north island.Bathroom was clean and there were 2 ! Very good value for money, couldn't ask for any better.

We booked two nights to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary - spending more than twice our usual budget. Kept waiting in a queue for check in which was unnecessarily complicated, then shown to a room that stank of smoke despite have booked (and confirmed on check in) that this was a non smoking room. Trekked back down 22 floors to reception - not a word nor eye contact from the new receptionist but placed in a cleaner room on the 31st floor. All extras are expensive (wifi free) - left an unpleasant taste. Room was good but that was to be expected for the price

Location wise the hotel is great, however after you have checked in then it all goes a bit downhill. The rooms are clean however the decor is 1970's, the carpets are 1970's and tts been a long time since a have seen a mini bar just placed in a room without being housed in a desk or something similar. The staff are nice but be aware, if you want to go and have a drink on the 33rd floor and you take a seat by the window they will charge you for the seat as well as the drink!! Next time I am in Tokyo it will be at a different hotel for sure

I like this hotel. The staff was very polite and friendly, and like many hotels in Tokyo, included almost all toiletries. The jet tub was just....LOVE. The hotel lobby is beautiful, but the rest of the hotel decor is pretty dated. I recommend eating at the hotel's restaurant just once. The view is amazing, and the breakfast buffer was great! However, it is a bit pricey at about $30-35. The pastries are amazing, but you can get them in the gift show for just a few dollars. The Tokyo Tower is just steps away, and there are Akibashi subway line is across the street. There are also convenience stores very close by. I did my research so I knew that the pool, gym etc. was extra, but I didn't mind since I was not in the room that often. The wifi, however, was free.

The hotel is perfectly located. The rooms are very big to the Tokyo standard, with shower + bath tub and separate toilets. Great choice of restaurants and friendly staff. Last but not least, the view on Tokyo tower is stunning.

Visited the hotel during my first visit to Japan. This is how a five star hotel should be by all means. Great service and location, very clean and excellent breakfast. I don't have a negative remark. Well done.

Right off the bat I want to say the only reason this gets 4 stars is because of the location. You are 15 min from any subway, so it's not the most convenient place when you're trying to sight see.I arrived here for the last two days I was in Tokyo. When I checked in, they had given my room away, but then upgraded me to a Jr. Suite. The room was amazing! It had a bar, living room, dining room and view of the Rainbow Bridge. Far to big for just me, but I'm not complaining.The service was impeccable and that jet stream bath made me finally understand why people take baths.They have a breakfast plan that you can add to your room. It' s a bit expensive, but the Western Buffet on the 30th floor was great. I had a view of the Tokyo Tower as I sipped on the freshly squeezed juice they made.

Stayed on the 28th floor and never got used to seeing the Tokyo tower almost an arms length away. The rooms have a great little balcony and you get to sit and listen to the calming music coming from the Buddhist Monastery next door. Great Views of Tokyo.
user_name:
aclaughan
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for the last 2 nights for the last two night of our holiday in Japan. And it didn't disappoint. We asked for a corner room in a high floor and the view was amazing. The hotel is very trendy, in a park and close to a Temple and a Shrine. There is also a free shuttle that runs every half an hour to the closest train station - Hamamatsucho which then takes you to anywhere in Tokyo.

We stayed here for a total of four nights and the rooms (Corner King rooms) were large, clean and well appointed and very reasonable by Tokyo standards. We only had breakfast buffet (continental) once in the hotel once and that too was pretty reasonable priced. There were several subway stations nearby which made getting to tourist sites really simple and quick. There were numerous cafes and restaurants within walking distance

We stayed here for 4 nites during our tour of Tokyo, and were very happy with the accommodations, services, and particularly the convenient location. The hotel is a 5 star hotel with all the amenities. We really enjoyed the Japanese breakfast in the lower level, as the Western/Asian breakfast buffet on the 33rd floor restaurant with awesome view. The hotel is located in easy walking distance (less than 5 minutes) to 3 subway stations, as well as about 13 minutes away from the Hamamatsucho station of the national railway. After learning our way, we found a multitude of restaurants were quickly accessible by foot via the more obscure East Entrance that is also positioned close to the nearby Zojoji Temple and Hibiya Dori street. Room was extremely clean and comfortable, and free wifi worked well. Hotel staff always had handy umbrellas for us on our rainy days, and as with all of Japan, staff here was extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful. We would love to stay here again upon any future visit to Tokyo.

Second time I stayed here, large rooms, great view, close to public transport, great reasonably priced shop in the lobby with all amenities - service is impeccable - forgot my bag in the sky lounge bar one night, delivered back to my room with not an item missing (there was quite a large amount of cash in my wallet) - the hotel restaurants are vastly overpriced, but that is to be expected. I stayed in a few hotel in Tokyo, this one is definitely my preferred choice.

Tokyo is out of this world, so much to see and do, Mount Fuji is a must just the trip to it shows how vast and different Tokyo is and the Bullet Train is FAST. Tokyo Tower and the Tokyo Skytree are two must do's, the Hotel is located for me in one of the best areas, Akabanebashi is a 5 minute walk and you can get to anywhere from this station, underground so easy to use, Bars and Restaurants a short distance from this Hotel, Loved it

Great place, had some wonderful days there with some friends. Outstanding customer service. Very close to Tokyo tower, that's why we chose it . Anything you want, the staff at the reception makes it happen for you. Small example: We asked if somebody could come and open the window for us - not even 15 seconds later somebody knocked on our door, entered with a smile, opened the window, said a few friendly words, and disappeared again with a smile - incredibly fast and professional service. Room itself was totally okay, was second highest categorie - no complaints at all! We enjoyed the sushi restaurant in the hotel - that's the moment when you realize that European sushi has not much in common with the original Japanese sushi. Give it a try when you are there, recommended!Beds, linen, as well as towels and bathrobes were available, everything high quality. Nothing to complain about! Cleanliness +++If you like Tokio, and you want to stay in a top notch place, this is it, do not hesitate, you will not regret your choice!

Indeed we enjoy our stay at this hotel. Its location is right in the park and next to Tokyo Tower, where you can see the views of park and Tower. We like the temple next to the park, too, where you can walk around and enjoy the peace and quiet. The hotel itself is grand but a bit old. Fortunately it's been remodeled; we really like the spacious bathroom with marble floor and HUGE tub. We also like the friendly staff and good restaurants. The only regret is that the carpet is so old that there is smell. Still it's a bargain in comparison with other hotels with tiny rooms.

I've stayed here twice now and love the place. It looks a bit like an apartment block from the outside, and not the most modern building in this wondrous city, but once inside the hotel has a luxurious feel and the panoramic rooms have what is surely one of the best views from anywhere in Tokyo. The hotel sits in a park so if your room faces the park you have an uninterrupted view to the whole of the beautiful Tokyo Tower (the one that looks like the Eiffel Tower), as well as Zōjō-ji temple and a full skyline of Tokyo skyscrapers. You could also see the SkyTree when it wasn't foggy. Our 'panoramic' room was very large and the marbled bathroom too. There are more luxurious hotels with more modern interiors in the city but you'll find it hard to find one for a similar price with such a view. I like the location of the hotel but some might not. From Akabanibashi station (5 minute walk from the hotel by the time you've crossed a busy road), on the Ōedo subway line, you can be in Roppongi in a few minutes, Shinjuku in 11ish minutes. For anywhere else useful though you'd have to change at Daimon and walk 2 minutes to get to the more useful Yamanote line at Hamamatsuchō. Roppongi has loads of shops, bars, clubs and restaurants but has a more international feel than anywhere else in Japan and isn't to everyone's taste because of that. You can walk there in 30 mins or so from the hotel. Near Tamachi and Mita stations you can find a street full of local restaurants for locals - didn't see any tourists and various restaurants are scattered here and there closer to the hotel - (just like any part of Tokyo). But Tokyo is all about its trains and they are a pleasure to travel on and quite fun - especially once you work out how the ticketing system works - staff at most stations will approach you if they see you struggling to work it out. The hotel appears to be used a lot for Japanese events including weddings - probably for the romantic view. I believe it does have a pool. We did not eat in the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I would recommend anyone coming to Tokyo for the first time to book a few different hotels in a few different areas - but really from any one location you can explore the whole city easily by train - but don't forget they are not 24 hours running until midnight or 1am. The hotel helped us arrange a coach back to Narita Airport at the end of our stay at a reasonable price as we didn't want to drag our luggage through the streets and up and down into underground stations although that would have been cheaper. Was only disappointed to find the fact that the hotel-branded water in the room was not complimentary as I'd expected it to be.

The Prince Park Tower Tokyo hotel is well situated in city center with a great view on the Tokyo Tower and related park. The rooms are nice, with a good size, good wifi and a very nice bathroom. The breakfast area is ok, since it is most of the time very crowded and very busy, again with a great view over the city of Tokyo. The selection of dishes is nice, mainly buffet style. It is indeed a good place to stay in Tokyo.

One of the best hotels I've had the pleasure of staying at. Clean room, topnotch view (spent hours just looking out the window) and high quality service. Good location with frequent complimentary bus to nearby JR station.Staff was helpful and spoke adequate english as well. Good convenience store at the hotel with good open hours.

Hotel is very clean and easy to reach. Views are great, especially from the topfloor. The hotel gives some voucher if you don't want your room cleaned, daily. I liked that. The hotels has many restaurants from typical Japanese to international cuisine. Best thing, however, was the shop in the lobby of the hotel with its own bakery. Very convenient if you prefer to eat in your room and don't want to order room service.

Stayed in this beautiful city hotel on my maiden trip to Tokyo, attending an international Conference. It is strategically located right in the heart of Tokyo city, about 30 minutes by taxi from Haneda International Airport, and only a short walking distance from the nearest subway station Akabanebashi (which links to other major stations such as Shinjuku, Tokyo Station etc)I found the hotel to be very spacious and the bubble lifts going up to the floors were really breathtaking. It has a nice garden/park just outside its grounds which gives a pleasant green lung-y feel as you walk or drive-in, and the staff are always so attentive and friendly. My spacious room had a nice view with a balcony of Tokyo city - (not facing the tower though) and the bed was a super-sized KING! Really unexpected for a Japanese hotel! The furniture though seemed a bit aged but well maintained and the cleanliness of the room is incredible!I had a choice of having breakfast either on the top floor or in B1 - but I preferred the one in B1 as it was in a very authentic Japanese Restaurant and they served breakfast set in a Bento boxes! Yummy!One thing that I also noticed, was the in-house store located strategically in the lobby - not only was it well stocked, but the items sold, from instant ramen to soft drinks and even some souvenirs were priced similar to any of the stores you'd find outside the hotel. Very reasonable! And the best thing it closes daily at 1am!I noticed there was a shuttle service provided to head down downtown, but I did not get to utilise it. Since the tube station was so nearby, it became my choice of transportation, apart from walking around on foot. If you were to walk say about 15 to 20 minutes, you'd pass an old temple and end up at an area near the Daimon Station where there are plenty of food outlets, some open till very late!All in all I would say that The Prince Park Tower Tokyo provided me a very comfortable home base for me to explore the city of Tokyo for the very first time. The service, the cleanliness and the location were just simply EXCELLENT! Wiil definitely return and next time it will be with the family!

Very elegant business hotel... Service is excellent.. The only negative thing is that the breakfast is really poor.. Many restaurants within the hotel. Wonderful Scenery from all rooms... Business center is weak...

I really enjoyed the stay at King size panoramic room.- The view of the tower and the city is Amazing! - The room is spacious.- Staff are friendly.- Shuttle bus (every 30 mins) to Hamamatsucho station is very convenient.- The hotel is in quiet area.- The hotel is few mins walk from 2 stations. - Roppongi is only few subway stops away.The only downside for me was that they even charged the water bottle with Prince hotel label. Those were very expensive but there are plenty of vending machines in Tokyo to pick up normal-priced water.

We stayed in the hotel for our last night in Tokyo as it is near to the Tokyo Tower, which we wanted to visit before leaving Japan. We did not get a room with the Tower view as told by the staff that those rooms were fully booked. The room is clean and spacious, though quite standard in all ways. The location of the hotel is really good as you can reach Tokyo Tower with 10 minute walk and Akabaneshi metro station is also within 5 mins walk, which takes you to places like Shijuku and Roppongi easily. However the hotel is quite far from Narita and it takes more than 1.5 hours by airport luminous bus.Staff are quite friendly and breakfast is nice.

We almost lost our minds trying to book a hotel in Tokyo just before Cherry Blossom season, with so many neighbourhoods and pricey hotels. Overall, we were happy with the location and stay at the Prince Park. It's a couple blocks from a subway line in a business district. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The view of the city was exceptional. The room itself was spacious, comfortable, and had all the necessities, but was somewhat dated in decor.

This Hotel is located close to the Tokyo Tower, close to Rappongi, by the metro station of Akabanebashi it is easy to reach Shibuya and Shinjuku.I recommend to ask for a room at an high floor, with a panoramic view, you could enjoy a fantastic view over the city.The Hotel is a very high standard Hotel with an excellent service and lot of amenities.In the Hotel you can find a smal mini market with a patisserie, 3 very interesting restaurants, expecially the GRILL in Tepaniaky style with a personal chef.On the Top at 33rd floor there is a bar with a view over the Tokyo Tower.

I stayed at the prince park tower for five nights last July with my joung son,the location was great, the room was very spacious and clean, the staff both at the club floor and front office spoke good English and were very helpful,we took the limousine bus from Narita airport directly to the hotel, we had many breakfast choices ,the happy hour at the club lounge was excellent, I highly recommend this hotel and definitely will stay here again

Having stayed in hotels in different part of the world, this is my first time to be in Japan attending a conference. The genuine hospitality is what really differs most, all service coming from the heart. We arrived midnight and didnt managed to book the transfer to we took the Tokyo Monorail up to the closest station near the hotel then a taxi for 10 minutes that cost us JPY830, not really bad. The hotel itself close to the Oedo Line Subway(2 minutes by walk). We used this everyday to go around the City Center or other places of interest during free time. The breakfast at Panorama 33 that gives you an undisputed view of the Tokyo Tower is magnificent, freshly baked cookies, scones, hard and soft bacon, the mouth watering fruits are just one of those that pampers us every morning for breakfast. More importantly and what really makes this a plus factor is the people working in this hotel. Service anticipation is paramount important to them, they smile despite the workload and take note they dont accept tips!(nature in Japanese hospitality) If given the chance, i will not hesitate to stay here again but ofcouse, with this service, comes with hefty rate per night. I forgot to mention that the shower and bathroom facilities is great as well, complete amenities! The bedroom and pillows were very comfortable too. A must when on this area of Tokyo!

Very spacious room, super king size bed, fantastic view & excellent service.Concierge speaks fluent English, knowledgeable and gave very good advice.All staff very courteous and helpful.......breakfast room very well organised.I can't fault The Prince Park Tower...its location also ideal.

The hotel is easy to reach from the airport by public transport. The building is nice, clean and spacious. The staff is attentive, friendly and helpful. The view over the park or Tokyo tower is nice and the next subway station is close by.I was paying corporate rate so the price was very reasonable. Because I requested a non-smoking room and there were non available I was upgraded to a small suite on one of the top floors. The view from the hotel bar is very nice and they serve decent drinks. You can also decline daily room cleaning and receive vouchers in return which will allow you to visit the gym, pool and the hotel's onsen for free.

Stayed one night with my family. The hotel itself is really nice. It doesn't look special from outside, but inside the architecture is really cool. The room was very big. It had a large glass front with a nice view. It even had a balcony. Bathroom was also very spacious. Service is really good. Staff takes care very much. All in all a great stay and certainly the best hotel we had during our 2 weeks Japan trip. Location is not perfect, but ok.

Spacious, bright and clean rooms. Comfortable mattresses. All amenities provided. Courteous staff. Decor is simple. Some rooms overlook the park and Tokyo Tower. It's close to the subway station, but there is not much to do around the hotel. We stayed there because it's close to my husband's office and we are paying corporate rate. If you are a tourist, the location is not very convenient. If you pay the regular rate as a tourist, it's better to stay elsewhere such as the Tokyo Station area or Shinjuku.

The staff at this hotel were exceptionally patient, courteous and polite on the phone and in person (though I think the Japanese are generally). The rooms were slightly pricey but very clean and comfortable. There are several good restaurants in the hotel serving a number of cuisines. However, I must warn you that the portions in the restaurants downstairs are small. It has a beautiful 360 view of the city and Tokyo tower at the penthouse restaurant. This hotel is close to the tube station and several convenience stores. The concierge can advise on tours and other information about things to do in Tokyo.Tips: Do change your cash to yen as dollars are not the preferred currency. There is a cash exchange machine at the hotel lobby and at the airport but you will most likely get a better rate at the bank in the city centre or airport. Credit card payments are preferred. Try to avoid relying on using your mastercard in Japan in general because it won't work. You can prebook an airport drop off at a relatively cheaper rate from the hotel. Finally, brush up on your Japanese, it will go a long way.

Our family stayed here during the holidays and were amazed by the elegance, the views, the bakery, and yes, the high tech toilet. Dollar for dollar this hotel far exceeded our stay at the Imperial Hotel. We fit four people in our room (2 adults, 7 yr old and 10 yr old), more than you can fit in most Japanese hotel rooms. We will definitely stay here when we return to Tokyo.

Really nice hotel with great staff and good restaurants. The rooms are spacious and good quality bedding, WIFI signal good throughout the hotel apart from the Chinese restaurant. The only issue I had and stopped with giving 5 stars is the AC in the rooms are inefficient and can only manage to get the room down to 24c. I moved rooms however the new room on a higher floor could only manage 22c, not good and needs to be resolved if the hotel is a 5 star standard.

I went there this year July , it is centrally located and very convenient to a lot of major shopping areas. Rooms are incredibly spacious for Japanese standards. But breakfast costs are expensive also you need to pay to use gym and spa facilities.

Stayed for 3 nights in July in Twin bedroom. Room was very spacious compared to other Tokyo hotels. The bathroom was to-die-for. It had a separate shower booth and an walpool bath. Bath salt was one of great amenities and gotta say I enjoyed it every night after a long day. The view was great as well. It was faced to chapel for wedding and park and Japanese shrine. As the name of the hotel indicates, it is literally next to the Tokyo Tower. It is beautiful at night. Behind the tower, one of the most famous Tofu restaurant is located. You need to make reservation if u want to dine there. Walking distance to Roppongi and 2 close metro stations. 1st floor has convenience shop and fresh bakery. Sadly no photo of the room. Only the view. But one of the best ones I stayed so far. Guranteed.

check in was slow as they couldn't find our bookings at first, after 20 mins they manage to retrieve our details... taxis are always on stanby.. our room is overlooking the zojo ji and also the Tokyo tower... very nice and quiet hotel, very eco friendly. if you choose not to get the room made up for a day, they can offer you $10 voucher to use in their shop... 5 mins walk to the train, but if you have stroller you'll need to go down the stairs...

We stayed at Prince Park Tower Tokyo at the end of February. We had a wonderful view of a temple and cherry blossoms. The staff was helpful and friendly. There are plenty of restaurants to eat at and it is very close to two train stations. The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms were fantastic!

I have stayed at the Prince Park so many times and, frankly, always loved it. It is very well situated for transportation, very close to Roppongi - and for me that means the National Art Center and sushi at Tokyo Midtown -- it has wonderful bathtubs and warm comfy toilets that raise and close their lids like magic when you open the bathroom door (yes, I realize how silly this is, but what can I say? ), if you face out over the driveway and have a balcony you get to look at all the twinkly Park Prince lights at night, and most importantly, there is a fantastic combini in the lobby. So for a great portion of the day and night, and for a very reasonable price, you can pick up that aloe yogurt, or a latte, or a sandwich, or really delicious pastries. And the airport bus comes right to the door. At night you can come in through the garage and by day you can wander out through the Temple. Hmmm, so what else do you need?

We had a good time staying in the Prince Park Tower - With a view of the Tokyo Tower from our bedroom it was a fantastic view to wake up to. The breakfast on the top of the floor was also a good spread, however not cheap. Sadly the pool was also with an additional fee (about £8 a go) which was disappointing. However the staff were very helpful and friendly. It was well managed and the rooms were always tidied and cleaned immaculately! There isn't much going on in Shibakoen so if you are looking to be right at the heart of the busy city centre then I would recommend somewhere in Ropponghi or Electric Town.

This hotel is conveniently located about a 10 minute walk away from Hamamatsucho Station (JR line) via a side street lined with huge variety of small restaurants and a Family Mart convenience store. If you walk, you can take a shortcut through the Hotel's East entrance on the South side of the Zojoji Temple or take a courtesy shuttle bus (one every 30 minutes) from the station but the bus stops at a couple of hotels on the way from the station (it is direct to the station from the hotel). Shibakoen Station (Toei Mita line) is right on the corner a 3 minute walk from the hotel's entrance as well. From there you can access most of Tokyo's subway lines and get just about anywhere conveniently, including Tsukiji.We originally booked a Corner King (which actually has a Queen bed) for 2 nights and asked if they had extra bedding or a rollaway when a relative unexpectedly visited with us. The hotel suggested that we re-book a Deluxe Twin Room which would have 2 twin beds and they would set up a third. The beds are actually slightly bigger than a US twin but still too small for 2 people and the room looked bigger than the picture. The check-in/-out was painless and the bed was Western but futon firm which was great. The free Wi-Fi worked pretty well, too.I would have given this hotel 5 stars for location and 4 stars as a hotel generally, but we are subtracting a star because the separate toilet room smelled pungently like urine. Public toilets in Tokyo were far cleaner and did not smell as bad as this tiny room. The fancy Toto washlet toilet has a disconcerting habit of opening automatically any time anyone walked by, which happened a lot since the toilet room was across from the shower/sink bathroom.
user_name:
HotAsianMama
New York City, New York

review_body: As first-timers in Tokyo, this hotel made for a splendid experience. I would suggest fishing for a room with a high view of Tokyo Tower. If not, any room in the hotel is worth it as well. The hotel's location provides a convenient opportunity to visit the Tokyo Tower. A great thing about the hotel is the wonderful breakfast buffet. A grand spread of Japanese, Western, and continental foods are provided. This was a great Tokyo experience.

Large rooms fairly wel insulated with good wired and wifi in room internet.To use the pool you have to pay approx 2050 yen, to use the gym you pay, for later check out you pay, to take shower after check out you pay. Breakfast you pay, a lot like 3900 yen pp for american breakfast.Bring your platinum amex.

Got a room at the 30:th floor with a view if Tokyo Tower. The room had panorama windows with an equally wide balcony so you could stand outside and enjoy the fabulous panoramic view. The beds were very comfortable. The room was equipped with an electric kettle and a capsule coffe machine (dolce gusto). The hotel had a little convience shop with a bakery where you can buy youghurt, snacks, bread, sweets and souvenirs. We did not try the restaurant on our two nights stay. It's a 5-10 minutes walk to get to an area with restaurants, but that was not a problem for us. Staff was very helpful and service excellent.This was our third and last hotel in Tokyo, perfect stay for our last two nights.

Sheltered under the gaze of the iconic Tokyo Tower and bordered by beautiful Shiba Park, the Prince Park Tokyo Tower Hotel is a lovely location to base your Tokyo vacation or business trip. We rented two rooms - a spacious corner double room with king size bed and a twin room. The views from the 18th floor were fantastic and the rooms very well equipped. The loos are something well beyond most western hotels - very high tech!! The service is excellent with very helpful staff who make such an effort to speak English. The downsides to pay attention to are few but notable - (1) the top floor has a bar with amazing views over the Tokyo skyline, but it is very pricey, there is a cover charge and my wife order a glass of champagne and was given a half glass. Not confined to this hotel, the Japanese still permit smoking in bars and restaurants and for me this is a real downer having enjoyed smoke-free dining and drinking in the UK for many years now (2) the buffet breakfast is very good but also pricey. There is no doubt you can eat and drink more economically elsewhere - there is a good bakery in the hotel lobby for example. The hotel is near a couple of tube lines and we found it very easy to get around the city from this base. The adjacent Shiba Park creates an oasis of calm in the midst of the City. We very much liked this hotel and decided to book in again after our adventures outside Tokyo.

Family of three was very comfortable in our clean and tidy room at the Prince Park Tower Tokyo. Bus shuttle from Narita Airport was very convenient as we were lugging a fair amount of luggage...enough to deter us from navigating trains and streets. Convenient location to tour around Tokyo, with multiple subway and JR rail lines within easy walking distance. While near the heart of Tokyo, the hotel felt a bit removed from the hubbub to me, perhaps because of the nearby parks and temple. We would definitely stay here again!

We had a twin room on 18th for three nights, we paid extra for view, very good rate via Booking.com. Reasonably spacious room, large windows, large bathroom. Eco-service (not replacing sheets etc. for one night) in return for a 1000yen voucher.What a view! We saw the Asakusa fireworks from our room. On the first evening after arrival we couldn't tear ourselves away from the view, so we ate in-the-room (expensive, not too special food).Staff was very forthcoming, helpful in all possible ways, especially the concierge who helped us get the earliest/fastest train to Narita Airport and let me print our boardingpasses.Subway stations are abound, at least three different lines closeby (3-7min walking) as well as a JR station (10min). In the direction of the trainstation plenty restaurants: ramen, soba, French, Spanish, cafes etc, much more fun & not quite as expensive as dining in the hotel! Family mart also in that area.

I stayed here for a week on business in April of 2015. The room they gave me was simply amazing. It was huge, luxurious, and had a fantastic view of the Tokyo tower. The location is central, and conveniently located near the expressway for my daily trip to Yokohama by car. The staff is very dedicated and excellent on all points related to customer service. 5/5 experience. Highly recommend.

I stayed here for one day when I arrived in Tokyo before a conference. It was compact but clean and tidy. Didn't eat in the hotel however utilised room for sleep and shower and some conference facilities.Hotel also held bags overnight which was very helpful.

location is good since its just across the famous Tokyo Tower. Room is average for a 4-star hotel. But its clean and staff are really helpful and friendly. I printed our boarding pass with no charge. Can easily schedule a limousine bus back to the airport.

Very well-presented hotel within a stone's throw of Tokyo Tower, subway lines, and great places to eat. I stayed for a week on business, had never stayed in a Prince hotel before, but was impressed. Staff was always helpful, hotel shuttle to a subway station was useful, and I especially appreciated the hotel offering 1000 yen in hotel credit per day to skip a day (or a few days) of cleaning. (How much service on the room is really necessary for one business traveler, anyway?). Would stay again.

Stayed four nights and did not want to leave. Beautiful rooms with a fantastic view. Super clean and top notch staff. Bathroom was spacious and beautiful, also had a view. Breakfast buffet a little pricey but didn't mind... Everything was fresh and plentiful. If I ever go back to Tokyo, I would definitely stay here again!

Stayed for a few days and found this hotel ideal. It is set in a park and has easy access to trains, over and underground. Shuttle bus is short ride to Hamamatsucho station with connection to JR line, Skytrain to Haneda airport and with coach terminal in same building. I would definitely stay here again having stayed at several other hotels in Tokyo previously. Only downside is breakfast not included but plenty of places nearby. try the Le Pain Quotidien only a few minutes walk away. In Japan a definite must is hiring a mobile wifi hotspot I used Japan Wireless and it was faultless.

This excellent international-class hotel is situated close to the Tokyo Tower and some 15 minutes' walking distance from Hamamatsucho metro station (which services the Yamanote line, easily bringing you to most of the interesting areas in Tokyo). For those who don't walk, the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle to the station.Our 19th floor room was spacious, clean, comfortable and well equipped. The beds were great, the wi-fi fast, the safe exceptionally large ..... and the view fantastic, overlooking the Tokyo Tower park. The bathroom was if anything even better, with a shower as well as a spa tub.The staff were very pleasant, polite and helpful, topping off a most enjoyable stay. Highly recommended.

Great service. Good size rooms. Clean. Beautiful and clean bathrooms. Breakfast not included. Walking distance from everything. Subway very close by. Situated on a beautiful garden. the view was spectacular! Ask for the room facing Tokyo tower. Kinda pricy but what isn't in Japan? Would definitely go again!

Only minutes away from Tokyo Tower this is a great place to stay if you want a great view combined with some luxury. The corner rooms on the top floor are spacious for Tokyo, and the bathroom is great. The hotel itself has a lot of choices for food and shopping, but if you want to go out you can grab something to eat at Tokyo Tower before challenging the stairs to the top. For families, there is a nice park with swings and slides within 10 minutes of the hotel as well.

Booked hotel through online. Met by middle age Japanese guy who had minimal english skills. Pretty sad to have people like that working in the front desk. I booked two twin bed and this guy said he will have to charge 5400 yen per night for having another person in the room. Even though there are total of two guests, this clown wanted to charge 5400 yen extra. Also, even as a hotel guest, you had to pay about 2000 yen to use the gym. What a joke However, service was decent and the rooms were little old. I will avoid this hotel for sure.

We spent three nights in this hotel. The location is excellent, with window views of Tokyo Tower, and a short distance to Hamamatscho station. The hotel does a bus ferry to and from this station. Also from the station you can catch the skytrain to Haredo airport. The line is free if you have a JR Pass. The walk to the station is only 15 min and is three stops from Tokyo station. Nearby is a Buddhist temple, and near the station is a food court inside the World Trade building. In the other direction we found a great supermarket. The hotel room is excellent and the staff were very helpful. Thoroughly recommend.

this hotel is huge, you can most likely spend an entire day just walking around it the temple next to it and eating at the numerous restaurants and bars. yes they are somewhat expensive but what do you expect in tokyo. the staff are some of the nicest and most accommodating people i have ever met in all of my travels around the world. Easy to get to from Haneda airport you can just take the monorail and walk to the hotel or grab a a taxi the fair is not that much 700yen. Walk to the Tokyo tower and the metro system is nearby, The rootop bar is not to miss.

I had a corner room which was large and had a great view. Ask for view on Tokyo tower if that is what you wish. The onsen is poor and depressing and shared with the other Prince Park hotel. Strange lobby with no bar and virtually nowhere to sit down, basically a bus waiting room.

We stayed here for 4 nights and managed to visit Shinjuku Ginza Shibuya Tokyo Ueno without any problem, in fact it was very easy getting the public transport.Airport bus shuttle there and back to Narita airport. Oedo line underground which is 4 min walk, hotel shuttle bus to the nearest JR station for a quick way up to Ueno. Didn't have breakfast here so can't comment. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The only problem I had was the toilet (bog) too small in the room. Bath/shower were great and separate from bog room. One last thing worth to mention is the hotel is next to a wonderful park and Tokyo tower! Request for a room that has a garden tower view.

i stayed here as it is one of the best hotels in Tokyo and i can't fault, the rooms , bathroom, toilet all first class, definately stay again, location is good close to tokyo tower and short walk to main centre nice gardens surround,

had a one night stop over on the way to make an early departure from Haneda International Airport. This hotel was excellent. Service was top level, room was spacious, well situated and with a good view.

My family always choose this hotel whenever we travel to Tokyo. The twin bed room is comparatively spacious among most hotels in Japan. Tokyo Tower is right across a few blocks. At night, u can take a beautiful pic of the tower by just coming down to the foot of the slope (the hotel is on a slope). 2 subway stations of different lines are within 5 min walking distance, going to Roppongi or Shinjuku (shopping area) very convenient.

The view of Tokyo tower from my suite was breathtaking. The level of service was very good, however they were certainly not in a hurry to get anything done in a timely fashion. Coming with a New York sensibility on a business trip made it a bit challenging in trying to schedule timing. Once they delivered everything it was wonderful but slow

I stayed at this hotel on vacation in April. I booked the room via Expedia. When I checked out and was reviewing my bill with the desk manager, he indicated that there was a 10% "Service Charge" added to the bill by the hotel.I explained that my confirmed booking with Expedia had mentioned no extra "service charges" and that I wouldn't pay it (it amounted to around $80USD). He refused to take the amount off of the bill.I have travelled a fair bit and stayed at other hotels, but never had this kind of fraudulent behavior attempted previously with a hidden fee.The hotel itself was okay. Not bad, not great. Location was not the greatest, but convenient walking distance to some attractions and to the river.I would recommend staying at a hotel run by honest proprietors.

Short walk to the subway. Free shuttle to the JR station. Room was clean and decently spacious. We booked a double room with a beautiful view of the Tokyo Tower. Shower (with excellent water pressure) and bath in a spacious bathroom. Nice program to exchange room cleaning service for credits to spend with onsite vendors. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again.

Perfect when staying some days in Tokyo, as everything in JP, its spotless clean everywhere..... Large rooms and balcony facing the tower and a nice quiet park... The Park cannot match central park or for that sake Hyde park... Breakfast and fitness excessively priced.... however park next door, and do some exercise there , have breakfast 5 mins down the road and you save easily $ 70 (!).... Perfect bar and restaurant at 33 floor, . again food and pricing are +5*

Love this place. It's our first choice every time visiting Tokyo. The hotel is is a little bit away from the Tokyo center, so the price is very good and rooms are spacious. But it's actually just walks away from subway station, so is still very conveniently connected.The highlight of the hotel is its stunning Tokyo Tower view. Do ask for a high floor room with tower view, even if you need to upgrade your room, you won't regret it. The breakfast offers a choice between Japanese style set meal or continental buffet, both are very appealing, if possible try both. The hotel stuff is very professional and fluent in English, also they are extremely attentive and polite, typical Japanese hospitality. The hotel room is very modern and spacious, you even have a small balcony, which is not common in many modern hotels. The bathroom is top class with a large Jacuzzi bath-tub, one of my favorites.Will definitely recommend this hotel is anyone traveling to Tokyo and who wants to be fascinated.

Chose the hotel as I got a great deal on hotels.com. Corner room excellent but the highlight is the bar on 33rd floor overlooking Tokyo Tower. Only downside is that drinks are very expensive, but the view is spectacular.

A fresh scent greets you as soon as u enter the lobby. The wonderfully courteous staff takes you to the reception to help you check in. Once done, a knowledgeable staff member will take you to the room and give an orientation!Nice restaurants, very clean and smart place. Must stay in Tokyo.

Stayed here for 5 nights with 2 kids. Room is quite spacious, we had a small balcony to step out onto. Didn't have a view of Tokyo tower as we were expected to pay extra when we requested for this. Beware of the mini bar charges, a small bottle go water will set up back Y400(US$3). We tried to go up to take a look at the view one night from 33rd floor but were told no kids allowed. I get that its a business hotel, but if you're a paying guest I thought this was grossly unfair. We just wanted to have a quick look but were told strictly no entry. Rooms were kept clean, bathrooms have very nice showers and big bath. We had breakfast in the area, theres a lovely french patisserie about 10 mins walk, also Starbucks not too far away. Hotel is 5 mins walk from Akabanebashi subway station.

I have stayed this hotel to attend conferences for more than 10 times, and I like it very much. First, it is close to Roppongi (<1,200 yen by taxi), a night life heaven for me with tens of live houses ! Second, the view of Tokyo Towel is great from the rooms and from the wonderful Sky Lounge Stellar Garden. Third, they have many nice restaurants: French in Brise Verte, Chinese in Yomeiden, Sushi in Hamashiba, Tempra in Tenshiba, Yakitori in Torishiba, Steak in Katsura, etc. Forth, the historic Zojoji Temple is next to the hotel.

I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights, the entire floor and room was smoked out, I requested a change and that floor was the same. Also if you have tattoos don't stay here, I was not able to utilize the spa facilities because I have tattoos...... How Bogus..

We stayed for 4 nights, Our room was kept clean and by all means this is not a bad place to stay. Our issues came with how cheap the hotel can be, access can be limited due to a large amount of weddings on location, you have to pay for pool access and when you do the pool is rather disappointing. In the bar guests were not even given a leg up on seating over people coming in off the street, and were still required to pay to sit.. We just generally got the snobbish vibe, don't get me wrong the place is very upscale and it was not surprising to get this vibe but if they want me to come away with a 5 star experience then some attitudes need adjusting.Pros: Great View, Clean, Classy, Position, and Availability Cons: Snobbish, Nickel and Dime effect, Beds were nothing special.

We had a great view of the Tokyo tower from the 14th floor and the beds were comfortable. We also had a jacuzzi in the room. Everything was super clean.This hotel really is quite okay and the concierge was very friendly and helped us book restaurants and gave us advise on which routes to take to get different places.The only negative thing I can say about this place is that I find it ridiculous for a hotel to ask money from its guests to access the gym, and it's also a little bit far from the yamanote line.

Very nice and conveniently located hotel.Not bustling with character but is ideal for a sightseeing or business base.Very close to several well connected subway stations.Nice bar on top floor!Would definitely recommend this hotel

This place ranked one of the best hotel I've stayed in during our vacation in Japan. The staffs were very polite, helpful, and speaks good English. The building itself was very clean and shiny *pika-pira and kira-kira*, and our room was perfect. The automatic toilet surprised me. Also, the breakfast is served on the 33th floor with stunning view of Tokyo Tower and the surrounding.

When a hotel charges $20 to access the gym and $20 to access the sauna this is highway robbery.When the same glass of wine costs 40% more in one restaurant than another in the same hotel it is crass. Charging $36 for salad, rice and miso which is usually free in the cheapest restaurant in Japan is excessive;even more so when the main course costs hundreds of dollars. $4 for instant coffee in the room...give me a break. It is a nicely located hotel and they offer large rooms with a nice view; but there is a bad aftertaste.

hotel is right by the Tokyo tower and near subway and JR train. It's a business hotel so the facilities are nice and modern, especially the bidet toilet seat, the lid opens when I walk in, 20+ buttons you are play with, and flush if you forget to...amazing technology...One thing I found about Japan is that when people speak Japanese they are VERY polite, but when they switch to English the politeness is lost, maybe because Japan is a country where if you are not very polite you seem rude. that's why I preferred the Ryokans but hard to find one in Tokyo.

Went to Tokyo for a Conference and Had to stay here for 6 Days, it is a bit far from Haneda airport but it was worth the ride since I had a glimpse of Tokyo at that time. Interior/Exterior: The hotel was very pleasant and the surrounding is very calm and city-like. The interior of the hotel was just amazing, I loved the water fountain in the middle of the hotel. It was very clean and tidy. Staff: The people are very polite and would greet you with a smile everytime you pass by them. I think the Japanese people are really respectful. Food: Their food are just equally good as their service. Try their Bar where you can see all of Tokyo's buildings, i suggest you go have a drink there at night. Bonus: This hotel is just a walking distance from the Famous Tokyo Tower, in fact you could see it through the hotel window (depends on your room view though) Overall I give this place a 5 cause I really enjoyed my stay and I hope to be back again here soon.

Nice and clean hotel, news paper on the door in the morning. Excelent staff, very helpful. I would moste defenitely recommend it. They had a well-stocked grocery store where you could buy her breakfast unless you wanted to eat the hotel breakfast.

Very central, next to the TV Tower. Loved the modern design. Fantastic rooms, breakfast on 33rd floor with a view over Tokyo. They have a great selection of western and japanese Food. Great service and attending staff. A metro station straight next door for an easy exploration of the city

With 2 subway lines at 10 minutes walk, with a 20 minutes walk JR station, the hotel can be easily reached and, at same time, you can go wherever you want in Tokyo. I did not use any facility because I was there for sightseeing, but there are. Staff is always available and very kind. Super is the machine for changing money in the lobby.

Very good hotel, the rooms in the superior categories are very large for japansese standards. Cleanliness is top notch and it is also quite well located in the centre of Tokyo. The view to the Tokyo tower is really awesome. Upon arrival I was upgraded to a superior category room by a very friendly and helpful staff. Very recommendable hotel if you're visiting Tokyo.

I have stayed here 6 or 7 times over the last year. The service and facilities have been declining since my last , very positive comment. The natural spa is stil a special pleasure in the center of Tokyo but regretfully even this does not outway the negatives anymore. I stayed at the premium floors with access to the lounge. The price of between 38000 and 70000 yen per night, depending on their availability ( but mostly their mood of the day ) is ridiculous high for a very average room, not even with a view on Tokyo Tower next door ( and this for their top rooms while from a number of lower floors you have magnificent views ). The lounge is really unacceptable and does not even deserve the name " lounge " , drink corner would be better. Compared to other hotels in Tokyo, at better prices , it is just a joke. So, whatever you decided, do not go for the premium rooms. The rooms are the same as the lower floors, just a few floors up. Breakfast at the lounge is inadequate to remain polite, the drink and cocktail service is near insulting to premium customers. At one time, this hotel was to be recommended, now, frankly, it is to be avoided. It should cost maximum between 20 000 and 30 000 yen per night. Everything over that is an abomination. There are much better deals now in Tokyo

this hotel is very clean, good location, good tourist spots around (tokyo tower, shiva park), good food - breakfast buffet and most of all very friendly and hospitable staffs. bravo. i would love to stay at this hotel again.:)

We enjoyed our stay at The Prince Park Tower Hotel. We loved our panoramic room. Oversized king bed was very comfortable and the extra living space helped us feel more at home. The hotel is luxurious & has many restaurant & bar options. My only two complaints would be the stale cigarette smoke smell on our floor. And, I was surprised by how loud the traffic is at night even all the way up on the 25th floor. That being said, we really did love staying at the hotel. We felt pampered by all the amenities.

Stayed 2 nights this past weekend at The Prince Park Tower Tokyo. Beautiful Hotel in with a great park setting in the middle of Tokyo. We used mainly trains to get around during our visit..Daimon station & Hamamatsucho station was a 10 min walk or you can take the hotel bus service which runs twice an hour. Akabanebashi and Skibakoen subway just in front of hotel. Room was very nice and quite large for Tokyo. The hotel is very upscale hotel at a reasonable cost. We had a rate of aprox $200/night. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice convenience store in the lobby. Visited the lounge on the top floor one night and took some great pictures of the Tokyo tower. Did not eat in the hotel. The Daimon train station area had hundreds of restaurants. It is 5-10 minute walk. Great stay and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Love the peaceful park where you can do some jogging in the morning .Close to everything. Amazing view of tokyo at night .They even have a free shuttle to a from the monorail station where you can take a ride to airport.

First, make sure you are not taking the Prince Hotel. In a typical Japanese way, the same organization has gotten two hotels in the same area under the same brand name: The Prince. This is the new one, and the old one is really rundown...The hotel displays a modern and complex design, very modern and with lots of light. The staff is very welcoming and will do anything to make you feel comfortable. The views from the room are stunning and the rooms are perfectly equipped. Don't expect any shops as you might find in other Tokyo hotels, but enjoy your stay.It will be comfortable and seamless.
user_name:
GeorgesUgeux
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here twice during a tour of Japan in March 2015.First stay for 3 nights, we had a room overlooking the Tokyo Tower, awesome view. Even without the view this hotel is one of the best we have stayed in.Great amenities, staff are so helpful, its incredibly clean and the facilities are fantastic.Second stay was for 5 nights, we got a room upgrade to a nice sized suite, was a bit worn, but still incredibly clean, amazing wall of windows and wet bar. They have a great hotel shop, with a bakery at the back so good for breakfast and the necessities. The location is great, walking distance of several public transport options and sights to see.Booked on the hotel website and got a great deal, better than the hotel booking sites.Will stay here again on our next trip.

was our home base for a week in tokyo and provided a great start/finish line for days of exploration. the suites are huge and the toilet seats are warm, not a bad way to do it. really don't have anything bad to say except the breakfast buffet was ridiculously priced, but it's alright because I could eat ramen breakfast, lunch and dinner.

I loved staying in the Prince Park Tower. It was about an hour and 10 minutes from the airport, so not too far compared to other placed, and an easy 18 minutes walking/subway to Shinjuku. The corner room we had was fantastic. the bed was large and comfortable (although a bit firm), the pillows amazing, the view from all corner rooms are good and I enjoyed looking out onto the gardens and shrine area (most prefer the sky tree view which is really neat but I liked this view). The bathroom is incredible with the wonderful jetted tub, separate shower, bath salts and every amenity, separate enclosed toilet room with the special japanese toilet with heated seat that opens when you walk in and closes and flushes when you leave. It was so peaceful, quiet, and luxurious feeling here it helps to unwind you and distract you from the busy crowds of Tokyo. There was great food nearby at all price ranges, but it is a 5 minute walk instead of right outside your door. This didn't bother us at all as we found the BEST food of our entire 14 day trip was near the Daimon Station. If you can get this hotel for around 200 USD or less it is a fantastic value and well worth the extra cost. Beyond that there may be other good lodgings. Personally I preferred Asakusa and Minato to Staying in Shinjuku as everything is just so busy and loud there. Wi-fi is very fast there and easy to use. To sum it up, I enjoyed napping and just looking out the windows and walking around the garden areas. It was lovely in Spring.

I traveler alone to meet my friends in Tokyo, and stayed this hotel last year. I cannot forget the view of my room! The room was just facing to Tokyo Tower. Especially, at night, the lights of tower was amazing:)The room was large enough, and had super big size bed! (I stayed in deluxe room at corner.) I ordered room service. The food was delicious and the staff of room service was well trained in my opinion. (Price was little big expensive to me T^T)At reception, when I check in and out, I could sit on the sofa, which is very comfortable:) Bell service was also nice. He kindly showed me how to open the door in front of elevator hall and inside of my room. Ah! there was automatic glass door what I needed to go through whenever I went up to my room. I felt safe thanks to it. It's located good place to visit Tokyo tower and park, but little far from public transportation... (I used taxi..... expensive.....)

Prince park tower hotel wins hands for its location. Draw back the curtains in your room and have a ringside view of Tokyo tower and zozo ji temple. The staff are extremely courteous. The travel desk deserves special kudos for good and right advice besides facilitating a very comfortable trip to mt. Fuji. They speak English too!

Absolutely loved staying in the Price park Tower hotel. Great rooms and the hotel store was a go to place for a morning croissant. Very close to Hamatsucho station aswell so travelling is not a issue.

we stayed here for 6 nights.Loved :-the location. So close to two handy subway lines-good room size-comfortable beds and pillows-deep relaxing bath-separate toilet with automatic toilet seat!-helpful staff-free fast wifi-lobby convenience store-amazing barCould be better-I know it's standard across Japan but why do you have to pay extra to use hotel facilities??Overall, a great choice!

Excellent service. Conveniently located hotel. Nicely appointed rooms. Free shuttle bus to and from Hamamatsucho station make it easy to access from Haneda airport via the monorail and easy to get around Tokyo using the Yamanote line.

This hotel is luxurious and the view was outstanding. I have nothing negative to say about our stay. The staff was kind and their helpfulness was over the top. The fitness areas are well maintained and the convenience store offers good food and gift options. I hope to stay here again.

A very nice hotel with beautiful views of Tokyo Tower from many of the rooms. Location is excellent, staff friendly and helpful, showers beautiful, beds comfortable, and rooms clean and sleek. My one complaint is that in Tokyo, I would have loved to see a little more character or Japanese vibe in the hotel. It is very stark and sleek, yet uninteresting.

This hotel had everything right for me.The location was at Tokyo Tower, in Minato. There are two subway lines a few minutes walk away. Shibakoen and Akabanebashi. The Marunouchi line is nearby, but I don't remember which one the other was.It is a 33 level hotel, with glass lifts. It has many restaurants in the under floors and even a convenience store of its own. There are other amenities such as a spa and a swimming pool. I do not remember if there was a gym, because I haven't used the extra services.The room we got was wonderfully spacious, had a view on the trees with a large window. We had twin beds. There is a large bathroom with a jaccuzi bathtub and a shower. The toilet is separate and top technology (some might get frightened lol)The beds are super comfortable. The service was top notch and always helpful.The sushi and tempura restaurants are good. A special mention for the wonderful tempura.. I loved the view on Mt.Fuji some of the mornings at the Brise Verte restaurant for breakfast. It comes in expensive, but it was so nice we returned several times. There is also a bar at the 33rd floor, which has an incredible night view on the city and Tokyo Tower.It is a rather expensive hotel, but when the quality is compared to others of the same price, reserving in advance to have the early bird price is really worth it. I would have stayed for my whole three weeks in Japan if I had the money.

Great hotel, and great amenities. The other reviews cover the highlights.If you're into fitness, this hotel is for you. There's a great exercise room downstairs. It seems daunting at first to find it, but it only takes 2 minutes to walk it. Much closer than many Las Vegas fitness centers in those hotels. The exercise staff is very friendly and can offer workout clothing, bathing suits, earphones and towels. The place is immaculate.Inside you'll find a full set of dumbbells and many weight machines. There are multiple treadmills, stationary bikes and elliptical's. The exercise room has stretch bands and mats.I didn't run from the hotel, but that would be easy. Attached to the workout area is an awesome two lane pool. Great temperature and the standard length. The pool area was empty every time I went.Back in the locker room is a traditional japanese Onsen - a hot spring. What a pleasure to workout with weights, have a quick swim, then join the other men in the Onsen. All inside the Prince Park Tower.

Great view, big rooms and bathroom, great service, gym and spa, swimmingpool, top location, roof bar strongly recommended!!!! One of the top hotels in Tokyo!!!! You are in the centre and can discover a bit of the city by walk :)

If this hotel was in London it would be 5 star and very expensive - great restaurants, rooms with great city views and some with Tokyo Tower / Temple views and as with every where in Japan, you can expect fantastic service and food.

Stayed in late December 2014 with a long-time friend. Neither of us live in Tokyo now, but happened to be in Tokyo at the same time. We chose this hotel because the review was very good. Booked a "Tokyo tower-view-guaranteed" deal though one of the Japaneses travel agents. The tower illuminated with "2014" was so near! Assuming that we would probably not get any better view from any restaurant / bar, we ordered our appetizers / drinks in the room and we had a great chat late into the night. The breakfast - if you are not a family, I recommend non-buffet restaurant. Much calmer.

We stayed here at this hotel because my fiance had a business conference here. We were in a premium floor room, which I mentioned because some of the amenities may not be available in non-premium rooms. We stayed on the 29th floor which had a great view of the city and a view of Tokyo Tower. There was also a balcony in the room that you could walk out on to get a better view of the surrounding city. The room was nice, although the bed was not comfortable. The bathroom was very large with a stand-up shower and a separate tub. The room came with free WIFI and as part of the room, we were given free breakfast in the lounge. The lounge also offered coffee, tea and snacks available throughout the day. The hotel is very large, there are shops along the basement and first floor. The hotel also has a restaurant and lounge area on the top floor that offers beautiful views of the city, particularly at night. The drink prices reflect those premium views, however, as they are very expensive. They also allow smoking in the bar area and you could frequently smell smoke in the elevators and hallways. The gym was a little cramped, but the locker rooms were large. Overall, we both liked the hotel and the hotel service.

I got food poisoning after dining in 33rd, I nearly black out for two days and yet they just put me a nonchalant treatment!Whether I live or die! I am positive it cause by food, because that was the only dining I had in a day. I threw up all the night and sleep in toilet! after that, They just get me a wheelchair to taxi and never come to check me again! I asked for three basic request. 1) Two more nights of staying, cause I'm incapable to get on flight. 2) The dining cost of that night. (I am the only one dining) 3) My medical expenditures. I didn't ask for any unreasonable or unfair refund, THEY REFUSE IT ALL! I checked out immediately that night and I will never NEVER come back to this hotel again!I was staying in Comfort room for five days, I thought I was a valued customer, Hyatt and Ritz will never treat me like this. Their standard operating procedure are worse than B&B hostel. Concierge can barely speak English, I have no idea what they talking, even the lobby manager!besides that,I have been to nearly 30 countries and I never heard there's extra fee for using the fitness center and swimming pool! Over all disappointed and they call it 4.5 stars. I had better service and room in a 3 stars!

The rooms were the most updated and larger than any other Prince Hotels we have stayed at. The toilet was separate from the shower which was really nice. The toilet room was automated where when you first enter the toilet room, the lights go on and the toilet seat cover lifts up. It has a bidet and a wash basin. The bath area has a big counter space for all your toiletries and a shower and a bathtub with jacuzzi. They provide all the ammenites that you need (i.e. brush, comb, toothbrush, japanese disposable scrub towel, razor, lotion, shampoo, makeup remover, nail file, etc.) They even give you daily complimentary water along with English newspaper. I had no problems with the free wifi. And there is a small refrigerator for you use. You just have to make room since the refrigerator is stocked with drinks and snacks that you pay for. Elevators were always fast and the included breakfast had options of either buffet or Japanese sit down breakfast. The breakfast vouchers allows you to use it for lunch at a set value. If it's more, you just pay the difference. It's about a brisk 10 minutes walk to the JR Yamanote Line Hamamatsucho Station and Daimon Station. There is a free shuttle bus that takes you there and back. The hotel is also close to the Shibakoen and Akabanebashi station. Once you go outside the hotel, you need to walk a minimum of 3-4 minutes in order to eat or shop. I say 3-4 minutes because if you walk outside the doors, you will not immediately see anything until you walk further. About 5 minutes away, there is a supermarket to buy what you need for your room. All the staff was very helpful and attentive. We used the bus service from Narita Airport (3100Y) and it's about a 1hr 45 min ride. As soon as we arrived, an employee came out with a luggage cart to whisk our luggae away to the lobby then to our room. If you are there longer than one night, you can opt to not have your room cleaned or serviced in return for a 1000Y voucher that can be used anywhere at that hotel. The maximum time you can do that is 3 nights. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

This hotel from my experience is the best I've stayed in! It really is beautiful and luxurious for a very reasonable price. We enjoyed lovely food and wine in the hotels restaurant with incredible views. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If I visit Tokyo again I would be straight back here! Location was close to train station in walking distance so easy to get around. We also made use of their shuttle service to the airport which was excellent.

I stayed in a corner room which faced Tokyo Tower. It had a wonderful view, especially at night. The staff at this hotel are professional and go the extra mile. The hotel is within easy walking distance to train and subway lines and the hotel also provides complimentary shuttle to JR Hamamatsucho station. First class dining located within the property. Convenient shops, services, and facilities are all located on site. The hotel is in a very quiet location next to Tokyo Tower, Zojoji and Shiba park. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

Stayed here for 7 nights. Our room was one of the cheaper rooms but it was lovely.Very clean, well equipped, really comfortable. The staff were friendly, efficient and very helpful. Close to subway and the hotel runs a courtesy bus to the nearby JR line every half hour.We used this a lot. The only downside is the very high price of food and drink at the hotel restaurants. There really is no cheap option. We often stopped for dinner at one of several restaurants at The World Trade Centre and then caught the courtesy bus back to the hotel. We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel and would happily stay there again.

Expensive?yes...money...money..money....but all the things that comes with it,is from da best of the best...try it out...for those who followed my reviews on hotel..u'll know what I meant!!!For those who has babbies with them,make sure u have all the necessary items such as diaper milk on so on..the grocerries shop...quit far...for me..

I spent two nights at this hotel, and firstly can I say I think it has the most comfortable pillow I have used in my entire life!For me, the location was great - right next to the conference venue I was attending and I didn't have much other down time so it worked well. I got a train from the airport into town and then a short taxi ride from there to the hotel. When I was leaving I got a very short taxi ride to the monorail and then to Haneda.The hotel is quite nice, a lovely lobby with some water features and checkin was quick and easy. There's a convenience store in the lobby where you can get snacks and other supplies which is useful. I didn't try the breakfast or either on the restaurants though. The room was nice, quite large for a Tokyo hotel - especially the bathroom. Bed was comfortable and room was dead quiet. The gym is OK, it has a smith machine and some good machine plus some light dumb bells along with cardio equipment. The big surprise though was that it cost extra to use, I think about Y2,000 but that got me a pass until midday the next day. Also the gym is a fair hike from the room, you walk through a maze of corridors underground.All in all it was a nice hotel and I would stay there again, extra payment for the gym is what brought it's rating down.

We stayed here in Dec 2012. We were upgraded to a room overlooking the Tokyo Tower and a Buddhist shrine (after we complained of a smoke odour in our first room). It is a beautiful hotel and a great location one block from a subway station and walking distance to attractions including Tokyo Tower and the World Trade Centre. Would love to stay there again.

The hotel was on sale during Jan, 2015. Overall it deserves its four and half star rating. Room is spacious and clean, renovations very high-end. Staff understand English well and are very helpful. Close to Toei Oedo Subway line, so it's pretty convenient to go to other parts of the city.

This hotel is fantastic - great rooms (mine was on the 20th floor overlooking the tower and the park) - the staff are so efficient, friendly and always trying to see if they can help. Sky bar well worth a visit at night - also great to have breakfast on 33rd floor with views over Tokyo (though I found breakfast buffet a bit on the pricey side). I had tempura lunch (wow!!!) and ate in the traditional Japanese restaurant too - fantastic food, amazing service. This is one of these places I will remember for a long time.
user_name:
IOWNat
Isle of Wight, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here in 2008 and I just realized I never left a review! We loved this hotel. Our bathroom had a window above the soaking tub that had the most magnificent view of the city. Check out the traveler's photos, you'll see some examples. The king sized bed was super comfortable and western-sized. The room was quite large, we were on a corner so we had an amazing view. Tokyo is spectacular at night, we were on the 32nd floor and it's really amazing. The hotel was clean, gorgeous, don't look down when in the speedy glass elevators :) Our floor was very quiet and the staff was very polite and helpful (as is the case everywhere in Tokyo that we stayed).The location was fine for us, we had been in the city for over a week by the time we had stayed there so we knew how to get around on the trains (which are super easy to learn, Tokyo has the BEST transit!); I would say maybe it's not the best place to start from unless you have your travel plans for the city fairly well mapped out, or if Tokyo Tower is a major attraction for you (it's walking distance from the hotel, it's cool - another option for a 360 degree view of the city.)This hotel is in the (or one of the) financial districts, there are some temples nearby but it's not in a visitor hotspot like Shibuya or Akihabara (Electronic City), and there's not a ton of restaurants around, but you can get around really easily so I'm not trying to dissuade anyone from staying here, just be aware that it's not like being in the center of all the action. Some additional travel info: We were leaving to return home from this hotel at the end of our trip, and the staff helped us with getting seats on a bus to Narita that picked up right at the hotel, it was TOTALLY worth the price and made everything so much easier - I think it ended up being around $40 each US dollars. I would highly recommend this. Also luggage delivery services from the airport to your hotel is the best and worth the cost. You do not want to be wrangling your luggage on a packed train, believe me.The hotel has a nice restaurant and a bowling alley! When we were there they served free American-ized breakfast on the 36th floor which is nice, saves time so you can hit the city and see as much as you can. Tokyo is beyond words, you could be there a year and not see everything. This hotel is really nice and an excellent option for a very reasonable Tokyo price. If we are lucky enough to go back to Japan, we'll stay here again.

Stained for few nights when visited Tokyo. Good location and facilities. Decent breakfast. Sky bar have great view at night time drinks are also ok, had one of baddest hangovers after visiting this bar :)

We stayed here last 3rd week of August 2014. Unfortunately, I forgot to write my review, so here it is. The location of the hotel is just right beside Tokyo tower. We requested for a room with a very good view of the tower, and they accommodated our request. The staff are very helpful and approachable. The amenities are really at par for a 5-star hotel. We had buffet breakfast for 3 days, but on the last day, we decided to try something new. They have a wide variety of food, the only negative thing is that, it is the same every single day. How I wish they change the menu from time to time. But over all, we had a great stay at this hotel.

Hotel is located near to Tokyo Tower, variety of restaurants in the hotel itself; nice view of the skyline from 33rd floor Sky Bar. The room is big with clean beds & very spacious bathrooms. The staff are very customer friendly & helpful.

The main part of the hotel itself was impressive in terms of decor and facilities (it even has a Cartier shop!) but the rooms were extremely dated and basic. I researched hotels for months and this seemed to offer the biggest rooms with amazing, huge marble bathrooms. We chose comfort over location though, not realising that it was quite remote. The public transport is near but we didn't know how to use it and it was raining badly and there are only stairs in the underground so transporting our baggage was a nightmare. Also, people can't speak English so we struggled to find places to go. Taxi costs are EXTORTIONATE. For breakfast, there was a little French cafe 5 minutes walk away which I would highly recommend. Otherwise you'd be paying £23 at the hotel! Don't expect them to be able to give you advice on places to go though. Do your own research and plenty of it!Although it was difficult to converse with the staff, they were very friendly and tried to be helpful but this seems to be the case all over Tokyo.

This was by far the nicest hotel we stayed in while visiting Japan! Large rooms, including bathroom. Complex menu on the wall for the toilet's many variations..... Ultra professional staff, lots of restaurants to choose from, great location by the Tokyo Tower. Couldn't ask for more. And the breakfast buffet on the 33rd floor was wonderful, as was the view! Floral arrangements throughout were outstanding, and the whole place was ecologically fit, with brighter hall lights only popping on as you approached.

Finding a place to stay in a foreign country can be a daunting task if you don't know where to look. But Prince Park Tower hotel is the place to stay for comfort and convenience.
